theorem algebra_2rootspoly_apatapbeq2asqp2ab:
  fixes a b :: complex
  shows "(a+a) * (a+b) = 2 * a^2 + 2 * (a*b)"
proof -
  have "(a+a) * (a+b) = (a+a)*a + (a+a)*b"
    by (simp add: distrib_left)
  also have "... = 2*a^2 + 2*a*b"
    by (metis calculation distrib_left mult.commute mult_2 numeral_2_eq_2 power2_eq_square)
  finally show ?thesis
    by simp
qed

theorem square_expression:

  shows "(-a + -b)^2 = a^2 + 2*a*b + b^2"
proof -

    by (simp add: power2_eq_square algebra_simps)

  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem algebra_2rootsintpoly_am10tap11eqasqpam110:
  fixes a :: complex

proof -

    by (smt (verit) diff_conv_add_uminus distrib_left distrib_right group_cancel.add1 mult.commute power2_eq_square)

  finally show ?thesis

theorem mathd_algebra_37:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes h0 : "x+y=7"
    and h1 : "3 * x + y = 45"
  shows "x^2 - y^2 = 217"
proof -
  have eq1: "y = 7 - x" using h0 by simp
  have "3 * x + y = 45" using h1 by simp
  then have "2 * x = 38" using eq1 by simp
  then have x_val: "x = 19" by simp
  have "x + y = 7" using h0 by simp
  then have y_val: "y = -12" using x_val by simp
  have "x^2 - y^2 = 19^2 - (-12)^2" using x_val y_val by simp
  also have "... = 217" by simp
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_110:
  fixes q e :: complex
  assumes h0 : "q = Complex 2 (-2)"
    and h1 : "e = Complex 5 5"
  shows "q * e = 20"
proof -
  have "q * e = (Complex 2 (-2)) * (Complex 5 5)"
    using assms by simp
  also have "... = Complex (2 * 5 - (-2) * 5) ((-2) * 5 + 2 * 5)"
    by eval
  also have "... = Complex (10 + 10) ((-10) + 10)"
    by simp
  also have "... = Complex 20 0"
    by simp
  finally show ?thesis
    by (smt (verit) Complex_eq_numeral \<open>Complex 2 (- 2) * Complex 5 5 = Complex (2 * 5 - - 2 * 5) (- 2 * 5 + 2 * 5)\<close> \<open>q * e = Complex 2 (- 2) * Complex 5 5\<close> diff_numeral_special(3) diff_numeral_special(8) numeral_Bit0 numeral_Bit1 semiring_norm(2) sub_num_simps(1))
qed

lemma algebraic_substitution:
  fixes a b c :: complex
  assumes "a + b = 2 * c"
    and "c = \<i>"
  shows "a + b = 2 * \<i>"
proof -
  have "2 * c = 2 * \<i>"
    using assms(2) by simp
  then have "a + b = 2 * \<i>"
    using assms(1) by simp
  then show ?thesis
    by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_192:
  fixes q e d :: complex
  assumes h0 : "q = Complex 11 (-5)"
    and h1 : "e = Complex 11 5"
    and h2 : "d = Complex 0 2"
  shows "q * e * d = Complex 0 292"
proof -
  have q_def: "q = Complex 11 (-5)"
    using assms by auto
  have e_def: "e = Complex 11 5"
    using assms by auto
  have d_def: "d = Complex 0 2"
    using assms by auto
  have "q * e * d = (Complex 11 (-5)) * (Complex 11 5) * (Complex 0 2)"
    using q_def e_def d_def by simp
  also have "... = (Complex (11 * 11 - (-5) * 5) (11 * 5 + (-5) * 11)) * (Complex 0 2)"
    by (simp add: complex_eq_iff)
  also have "... = (Complex (121 + 25) (55 - 55)) * (Complex 0 2)"
    by simp
  also have "... = Complex 146 0 * Complex 0 2"
    by simp
  also have "... = Complex 0 (292)"
    by eval
  finally have "q * e * d = Complex 0 (292)"
    by simp
  then show ?thesis
    by simp
qed

lemma mod_add_power:
  fixes x n a b c :: nat
  assumes "n > 0" "b > 0" "c > 0" "x mod n = a"
  shows "((x + b)^c) mod n = ((a + b)^c) mod n"
proof -
  have "(x + b)^c mod n = ((x mod n) + b)^c mod n"
    by (smt (verit) mod_add_left_eq power_mod)
  also have "... = (a + b)^c mod n"
    using assms(4) by auto
  finally show ?thesis by auto
qed

lemma am_gm:
  fixes x::real
  assumes "x > 0"
  shows "x + 1/(2*x) \<ge> sqrt 2"
proof -
  have "x > 0 \<and> 1/(2*x) > 0" using assms by simp
  then have "(x + 1/(2*x)) / 2 \<ge> sqrt (x * (1/(2*x)))" by (metis arith_geo_mean_sqrt assms div_by_1 divide_eq_0_iff divide_le_0_iff divide_le_eq_1_pos le_divide_eq_1 le_numeral_extra(3) less_numeral_extra(3) mult.commute mult_2_right zero_le_divide_1_iff zero_le_double_add_iff_zero_le_single_add)
  then have "(x + 1/(2*x)) / 2 \<ge> sqrt ((x * 1) / (2*x))" by simp
  then have "(x + 1/(2*x)) / 2 \<ge> sqrt (1 / 2)" by (metis \<open>0 < x \<and> 0 < 1 / (2 * x)\<close> add.right_neutral add_divide_eq_if_simps(2) add_divide_eq_iff comm_monoid_mult_class.mult_1 dbl_def dbl_simps(3) div_by_1 div_self divide_divide_eq_right double_zero_sym less_add_same_cancel2 mult.commute mult_2 nonzero_mult_div_cancel_left one_add_one power_inject_exp power_one times_divide_times_eq zero_neq_numeral zero_neq_one)
  then have "(x + 1/(2*x)) / 2 \<ge> (sqrt 1) / (sqrt 2)" by (metis frac_eq_eq mult.commute mult_2_right real_sqrt_divide zero_neq_numeral)
  then have "(x + 1/(2*x)) / 2 \<ge> 1 / (sqrt 2)" by simp
  then have "(x + 1/(2*x)) / 2 \<ge> sqrt 2 / (sqrt 2 * sqrt 2)" by (smt (verit) \<open>sqrt 1 / sqrt 2 \<le> (x + 1 / (2 * x)) / 2\<close> nonzero_divide_mult_cancel_left real_sqrt_eq_zero_cancel real_sqrt_one)
  then have "(x + 1/(2*x)) / 2 \<ge> sqrt 2 / 2" by simp
  then have "x + 1/(2*x) \<ge> 2 * (sqrt 2 / 2)" by simp
  then have "x + 1/(2*x) \<ge> sqrt 2" by simp
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma am_gm:
  fixes x::real
  assumes "x > 0"
  shows "x + 1/(2*x) \<ge> sqrt 2"
proof -
  have "(sqrt x - sqrt (1/(2*x)))^2 \<ge> 0" by simp
  then have "x + 1/(2*x) - 2 * sqrt x * sqrt (1/(2*x)) \<ge> 0"
    by (smt (verit) add_le_imp_le_diff assms divide_nonneg_nonneg less_eq_real_def real_sqrt_pow2 sum_squares_bound)
  then have "x + 1/(2*x) - sqrt 2 \<ge> 0"
    by (metis add_divide_distrib assms div_by_1 divide_divide_eq_right divide_self less_numeral_extra(3) mult_2 one_add_one real_div_sqrt real_sqrt_divide real_sqrt_eq_1_iff real_sqrt_gt_0_iff real_sqrt_one times_divide_eq_right zero_le_numeral)
  then have "x + 1/(2*x) \<ge> sqrt 2" by simp
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma amgm_inequality:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "a > 0" "b > 0"
  shows "(a^2 + b^2) / 2 \<ge> a * b"
proof -
  have "(a - b)^2 \<ge> 0"

  then have "a^2 - 2 * a * b + b^2 \<ge> 0"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps power2_diff)
  then have "a^2 + b^2 \<ge> 2 * a * b"
    by simp
  then have "(a^2 + b^2) / 2 \<ge> a * b"
    by simp
  then show ?thesis 
    by simp
qed

lemma algebra_a4leq4ta4pb4_general:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes h0 : "0 < a \<and> 0 < b"
  shows "a^4 \<le> 4*(a^4 + b^4)"
proof -

  then have "4 * (a^4) \<le> 4 * (a^4 + b^4)" by (simp add: mult_right_mono)
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed

  then have "a^2 + b^2 \<ge> 2 * a * b"

lemma algebra_a4leq4ta4pb4:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes h0 : "0 < a \<and> 0 < b"
  shows "a^4 \<le> 4*(a^4 + b^4)"
proof -
  have "0 \<le> a^4" by simp
  moreover have "0 \<le> b^4" by simp
  ultimately have "0 \<le> a^4 + b^4" by simp
  then have "4 * 0 \<le> 4 * (a^4 + b^4)" by (simp add: mult_right_mono)
  then have "0 \<le> 4 * (a^4 + b^4)" by simp
  then have "a^4 \<le> 4 * (a^4 + b^4) - b^4" by (simp add: right_diff_distrib)
  then have "a^4 \<le> 4*a^4 + 4*b^4 - b^4" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then have "a^4 \<le> 4*a^4 + 3*b^4" by simp
  then have "a^4 - a^4 \<le> 4*a^4 + 3*b^4 - a^4" by simp
  then have "0 \<le> 3*a^4 + 3*b^4" by simp
  then have "0/3 \<le> (3*a^4 + 3*b^4)/3" by (simp add: divide_nonneg_pos)
  then have "0 \<le> a^4 + b^4" by simp
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

  then have "a^4 \<le> 4 * (a^4 + b^4) - b^4" by (simp add: right_diff_distrib)
  then have "a^4 \<le> 4*a^4 + 4*b^4 - b^4" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then have "a^4 \<le> 4*a^4 + 3*b^4" by simp
  then show ?thesis by simp

lemma algebra_asqleq2abp2bsq:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes h0 : "0 < a \<and> 0 < b"

lemma cancle_div:
  fixes x a b c:: real
  assumes "x > 0" "a + b / x = c"
  shows "a * x + b = c * x"
proof -
  have "x * (a + b / x) = c * x"
    using assms(2) by auto
  then have "x * a + x * (b / x) = c * x"
    by (simp add: distrib_left)
  then show ?thesis
    using assms(1) by (simp add: mult.commute)
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_51:
  fixes a b ::real
  assumes "0 < a \<and> 0 < b"
    and "a + b = 35"
    and "a = (2/5) * b"
  shows "b - a = 15"
proof -
  let ?a = "a"
  let ?b = "b"
  have "0 < ?a \<and> 0 < ?b" using assms by auto
  have "?a + ?b = 35" using assms by auto
  have "?a = (2/5) * ?b" using assms by auto
  have eq1: "(2/5) * ?b + ?b = 35" using \<open>?a + ?b = 35\<close> \<open>?a = (2/5) * ?b\<close> by simp
  have eq2: "(7/5) * ?b = 35" using eq1 by simp
  have eq3: "?b = (5/7) * 35" using eq2 by simp
  have eq4: "?b = 25" using eq3 by simp
  have eq5: "?a = (2/5) * 25" using \<open>?a = (2/5) * ?b\<close> \<open>?b = 25\<close> by simp
  have eq6: "?a = 10" using eq5 by simp
  have "b - a = 25 - 10" using \<open>?b = 25\<close> \<open>?a = 10\<close> by simp
  then have "b - a = 15" by simp
  then show ?thesis by auto
qed

    by simp
  finally show ?thesis
    by simp
qed

theorem divide_fractions:

  fixes x y :: real

lemma algebra_sqineq_2xyxysq:
  fixes x y :: real
  shows "x^2 + y^2 \<ge> 2 * x * y"
proof -
  have "(x - y)^2 \<ge> 0"
    by simp
  then have "x^2 - 2 * x * y + y^2 \<ge> 0"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps power2_diff)
  then have "x^2 + y^2 \<ge> 2 * x * y"
    by simp
  then show ?thesis 
    by simp
qed

theorem algebra_sqineq_36azm9asqle36zsq:
  fixes z a :: real
  shows "36 * (a * z) - 9 * a^2 \<le> 36 * z^2"
proof -
  have c1: "36 * (a * z) - 9 * a^2 = 2 * (3 * a) * (6 * z) - (3 * a)^2"
    by (simp add: power2_eq_square)
  have c2: "2 * (3 * a) * (6 * z) \<le> (3 * a)^2 + (6 * z)^2"
    using algebra_sqineq_2xyxysq[of "3 * a" "6 * z"] by simp
  have c3: "(3 * a)^2 + (6 * z)^2 \<ge> 2 * (3 * a) * (6 * z)"
    using algebra_sqineq_2xyxysq[of "3 * a" "6 * z"]
    by simp
  have "2 * (3 * a) * (6 * z) \<le> (3 * a)^2 + (6 * z)^2"
    using c2 c3 by simp
  then have "36 * (a * z) - 9 * a^2 \<le> 36 * z^2"
    using c1 by simp
  then show ?thesis 
    by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_327:
  fixes a :: real
  assumes h0 : "1 / 5 * abs(9 + 2 * a) < 1"
  shows "-7 < a \<and> a < -2"
proof -
  have c0: "abs(9 + 2 * a) < 5"
    using h0 by simp
  have c1: "9 + 2 * a < 5 \<or> -(9 + 2 * a) < 5"
    using c0 by auto
  have c2: "9 + 2 * a < 5 \<Longrightarrow> a < -2"
    by simp
  have c3: "-(9 + 2 * a) < 5 \<Longrightarrow> -9 - 2 * a < 5"
    by simp
  have c4: "-9 - 2 * a < 5 \<Longrightarrow> -14 < 2 * a"
    by simp
  have c5: "-14 < 2 * a \<Longrightarrow> -7 < a"
    by simp
  from c1 c2 c3 c4 c5 show ?thesis by (metis abs_less_iff c0 diff_numeral_special(10) minus_diff_commute mult_2 mult_minus_right numeral_times_minus_swap one_add_one)
qed

lemma subst:
  fixes f::"real \<Rightarrow> real"
    and a b c::real
  assumes "\<forall> x. f (x+3) = 3 * x^2 + 7*x + 4"
    and "\<forall> x. f x = a * x^2 + b * x + c"
  shows "f 1 = a + b + c"
proof -
  have "f 1 = f (-2+3)" 
    by simp
  also have "... = 3 * (-2)^2 + 7 * (-2) + 4" 
    using assms(1) by blast
  also have "... = 12 - 14 + 4" 
    by simp
  finally have "f 1 = 2" 
    by simp
  then show ?thesis 
    using assms(2) by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_214:
  fixes a :: real
    and f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes h0 : "\<And>x. f x = a * (x-2)^2 + 3"
    and h1 : "f 4 = 4"
  shows "f 6 = 7"
proof -
  have "f x = a * (x-2)^2 + 3" using h0 by auto
  then have "4 = a * (4-2)^2 + 3" using h1 by (metis h0)
  then have "a = 1/4" by simp
  then have "f 6 = 1/4 * (6-2)^2 + 3" using h0 by simp
  then have "f 6 = 7" by simp
  then show "f 6 = 7" by auto
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_43:
  fixes a b :: real
    and f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes h0 : "\<And>x. f x = a * x + b"
    and h1 : "f 7 = 4"
    and h2 : "f 6 = 3"
  shows "f 3 = 0"
proof -
  have "a = (f 7 - f 6) / (7 - 6)" using assms by simp
  then have "a = 1" using assms by simp
  have "f x = x + b" using h0 \<open>a = 1\<close> by simp
  have "f x = 0 \<longleftrightarrow> x + b = 0" using \<open>f x = x + b\<close> by simp
  have "f 3 = 0 \<longleftrightarrow> 3 + b = 0" using \<open>f x = 0 \<longleftrightarrow> x + b = 0\<close> by (metis \<open>a = 1\<close> add.commute comm_monoid_mult_class.mult_1 h0 semiring_norm(3))
  then have "f 3 = 0" using assms by simp
  then show ?thesis by auto
qed

lemma log_base_real:

  assumes "b > 0" "x > 0" "b \<noteq> 1" "x \<noteq> 1"
  shows "log b x = ln x / ln b"
  using assms by (simp add: log_def)

lemma log_base_log_base_real:
  fixes b x :: real
  assumes "b > 0" "x > 0" "b \<noteq> 1" "x \<noteq> 1"
  shows "log b (log b x) = log b (ln x / ln b)"

  assumes "a > 0 \<and> b > 0"
  shows "ln (a / b) = ln a - ln b"

theorem logarithm_exponentiation:
  fixes b :: real
  assumes "4 powr b = 4"
  shows "b = 1"
proof -
  have "log 4 (4 powr b) = log 4 4" using assms by simp
  then have "b = 1" by simp
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma log_of_power:
  fixes a b x :: real
  assumes "0 < a" "0 < b"
  shows "log a (b powr x) = x * log a b"
proof -
  have "log a (b powr x) = log a (exp (x * ln b))" by (metis assms(2) exp_ln less_numeral_extra(3) ln_powr powr_gt_zero)
  also have "... = x * log a (exp (ln b))" using assms by (metis calculation exp_ln less_numeral_extra(3) log_powr)
  also have "... = x * log a b" by (metis assms(2) exp_ln)
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

  assumes "4 powr b + 2^3  = 12"

  then have "4 powr b = 4" by simp

  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem amc12a_2021_p7:
  fixes x y ::real
  shows "1 \<le> ((x * y) - 1)^2 + (x + y)^2"
proof -
  have "((x * y) - 1)^2 + (x + y)^2 = (x^2*y^2 - 2*x*y + 1) + (x^2 + 2*x*y + y^2)" by sos
  also have "... = x^2*y^2 - 2*x*y + 1 + x^2 + 2*x*y + y^2" by simp
  also have "... = x^2*y^2 + x^2 + y^2 + 1" by simp
  also have "... = (x^2 + 1)*(y^2 + 1)" by sos

  finally show "1 \<le> ((x * y) - 1)^2 + (x + y)^2" .
qed

theorem amc12a_2008_p8:
  fixes x y::real
  assumes h0: "0 < x \<and> 0 < y"
    and h1: "y^3 = 1"
    and h2: "6 * x^2 = 2 * (6 * y^2)"
  shows "x^3 = 2 * sqrt 2"
proof -
  have c0: "y = 1"
    using h1 by sos
  have c1: "6 * y^2 = 6"
    unfolding c0 by auto
  have c2: "2 * (6 * y^2) = 12"
    unfolding c1 by auto
  have c3: "x = sqrt 2"
    using h2 c2 by (smt (verit) h0 less_eq_real_def real_le_lsqrt real_le_rsqrt)
  have "x^3 = (sqrt 2)^3"
    using c3 by auto
  also have "... = 2 * sqrt 2"
    by (simp add: power3_eq_cube)
  finally show ?thesis by auto
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_37:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes h0 : "x+y=7"
    and h1 : "3 * x + y = 45"
  shows "x^2 - y^2 = 217"
proof -
  have eq1: "y = 7 - x" using h0 by simp
  have "3 * x + y = 45" using h1 by simp
  then have "2 * x = 38" using eq1 by simp
  then have x_val: "x = 19" by simp
  have "x + y = 7" using h0 by simp
  then have y_val: "y = -12" using x_val by simp
  have "x^2 - y^2 = 19^2 - (-12)^2" using x_val y_val by simp
  also have "... = 217" by simp
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma aimeII_2001_p3_lemma1:
  fixes x :: "nat \<Rightarrow> int"
  assumes h0 : "x 1 = 211"
    and h1 : "x 2 = 375"
    and h2 : "x 3 = 420"
    and h3 : "x 4 = 523"

  shows "x = 6/7"
proof -

  hence "x * (3 / 6 + 4 / 6) = 1" by simp
  hence "x * (7 / 6) = 1" by simp
  hence "(x * (7 / 6)) * (6 / 7) = 1 * (6 / 7)" by simp
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_126:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes h0 : "2 * 3 = x - 9"
    and h1 : "2 * (-5) = y + 1"
  shows "x=15 \<and> y = -11"
proof -
  have midpt: "(x+(-9))/2 = 3 \<and> (y+1)/2 = -5"
    using assms by simp
  have eq1: "(x+(-9))/2 = 3" using midpt by simp
  have eq2: "(y+1)/2 = -5" using midpt by simp
  have "x+(-9) = 2 * 3" using eq1 by simp
  then have "x = 15" by simp
  have "y+1 = 2 * (-5)" using eq2 by simp
  then have "y = -11" by simp
  then show ?thesis using \<open>x = 15\<close> by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_245:
  fixes x :: real
  assumes h0 : "x \<noteq> 0"
  shows "1/(4/x) * ((3*x^3)/x)^2 * (1/(1 / (2 * x)))^3 = 18 * x^8"
proof -
  have "1/(4/x) = x/4"
    using assms by simp
  have "((3*x^3)/x)^2 = 9*x^4"
    using assms by (auto simp: field_simps)
  have "(1/(1 / (2 * x)))^3 = (2*x)^3"
    using assms by simp
  have "1/(4/x) * ((3*x^3)/x)^2 * (1/(1 / (2 * x)))^3 = (x/4) * (9*x^4) * (8*x^3)"
    using assms by (auto simp: field_simps)
  have "(x/4) * (9*x^4) * (8*x^3) = 18 * x^8"
    using assms by sos
  then show ?thesis
    by sos
qed

theorem amc12a_2013_p7:
  fixes s :: "nat \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes h0 : "\<And>n. s (n+2) = s (n+1) + s n"
    and h1 : "s 9 = 110"
    and h2 : "s 7 = 42"
  shows "s 4 = 10"
proof -
  have c0: "s 8 = s 9 - s 7" using h0[of "7"] h0[of "8"] by simp
  also have "... = 110 - 42" using h1 h2 by simp
  also have "... = 68" by simp
  finally have c0: "s 8 = 68" by simp
  have c1: "s 6 = s 8 - s 7" using h0[of "6"] h0[of "7"] by simp
  also have "... = 68 - 42" using c0 h2 by simp
  also have "... = 26" by simp
  finally have c1: "s 6 = 26" by simp
  have c2: "s 5 = s 7 - s 6" using h0[of "5"] h0[of "6"] by simp
  also have "... = 42 - 26" using h2 c1 by simp
  also have "... = 16" by simp
  finally have c2: "s 5 = 16" by simp
  have c3: "s 4 = s 6 - s 5" using h0[of "4"] h0[of "5"] by simp
  also have "... = 26 - 16" using c1 c2 by simp
  also have "... = 10" by simp
  finally have c3: "s 4 = 10" by simp
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem amc12a_2016_p3:
  fixes f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes h0 : "\<And>x y. f x y = x - y * floor (x/y)"
  shows "f ((3::real)/8) (- 2/5) = - 1/40"
proof -
  have "f ((3::real)/8) (- 2/5) = ((3::real)/8) - (- 2/5) * floor (((3::real)/8)/(- 2/5))"
    using h0 by simp
  have "... = (3::real)/8 - (- 2/5) * floor (((3::real)/8)/(- 2/5))"
    by simp
  have "... = (3::real)/8 - (- 2/5) * (-1)"
    by simp
  have "... = -1/40"
    by simp
  then show ?thesis by (metis \<open>3 / 8 - - 2 / 5 * real_of_int \<lfloor>3 / 8 / (- 2 / 5)\<rfloor> = 3 / 8 - - 2 / 5 * - 1\<close> \<open>f (3 / 8) (- 2 / 5) = 3 / 8 - - 2 / 5 * real_of_int \<lfloor>3 / 8 / (- 2 / 5)\<rfloor>\<close> dbl_inc_simps(3) dbl_simps(3))
qed

lemma f_1_3:
  fixes f :: "nat \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes h0 : "f 1 = 2"
    and h1 : "\<And>n. (1 < n \<and> even n) \<Longrightarrow> f n = f (n - 1) + 1"
    and h2 : "\<And>n. (1 < n \<and> odd n) \<Longrightarrow> f n = f (n - 2) + 2"
  shows "f 3 = 4"
proof -
  have "f 3 = f 1 + 2" using h2[of "3"] by auto
  also have "... = 2 + 2" using h0 by auto
  finally show ?thesis by auto
qed

    and h2 : "\<And>n. (1 < n \<and> odd n) \<Longrightarrow> f n = f (n - 2) + 2"
    and n_def : "n = 3"

theorem amc12a_2009_p9:
  fixes a b c::real
    and f::"real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes h0:"\<forall> x. f (x+3) = 3 * x^2 + 7*x + 4"
    and h1:"\<forall> x. f x = a * x^2 + b * x + c"
  shows "a+b+c=2"
proof -
  have "f (-2+3) = 3 * (-2)^2 + 7 * (-2) + 4" using h0 by blast
  hence "f 1 = 3 * (-2)^2 + 7 * (-2) + 4" by simp
  also have "f 1 = a + b + c" using h1 by simp
  finally have "a + b + c = 2" by simp
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem amc12a_2009_p9:
  fixes a b c::real
    and f::"real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes h0:"\<forall> x. f (x+3) = 3 * x^2 + 7*x + 4"
    and h1:"\<forall> x. f x = a * x^2 + b * x + c"
  shows "a+b+c=2"
proof -
  have "f x = a * x^2 + b * x + c" using h1 by simp
  have "f (x+3) = 3 * x^2 + 7*x + 4" using h0 by simp
  have "f (-2+3) = 3 * (-2)^2 + 7 * (-2) + 4" using h0 by blast
  have "f 1 = 3 * (-2)^2 + 7 * (-2) + 4" using h0 by (metis Suc_1 \<open>f (- 2 + 3) = 3 * (- 2)\<^sup>2 + 7 * - 2 + 4\<close> add.commute dbl_def dbl_inc_def dbl_inc_simps(3) dbl_inc_simps(5) dbl_simps(3) dbl_simps(5) minus_add_cancel minus_mult_minus mult.commute mult_2 mult_2_right mult_minus_left mult_minus_right power2_eq_square)
  then have "f 1 = 2" by simp
  then show ?thesis using h1 by simp
qed

proof -

theorem amc12a_2011_p18:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes h0 : "abs (x+y) + abs (x-y) = 2"

  have c1: "x^2 - 6 * x + y^2 = (x-3)^2 + y^2 - 9" by sos
  have c2: "(x-3)^2 + y^2 - 9 = (sqrt((x-3)^2 + y^2))^2 - 9" by simp
  have c3: "(x-3)^2 + y^2 - 9 \<le> 8" using c2 by (smt (verit) add_cancel_right_right add_decreasing2 add_diff_cancel_left' add_le_same_cancel1 c1 diff_mono eq_iff_diff_eq_0 group_cancel.add1 h0 le_add_diff_inverse le_add_same_cancel2 le_iff_diff_le_0 less_eq_real_def mult_mono power2_diff power2_eq_square power2_le_imp_le power2_sum real_le_lsqrt real_less_lsqrt real_sqrt_abs real_sqrt_four real_sqrt_ge_1_iff real_sqrt_le_1_iff real_sqrt_lt_0_iff real_sqrt_mult_self real_sqrt_one real_sqrt_pow2_iff sqrt_ge_absD zero_power2)
  then show ?thesis using c1 by simp
qed

lemma prime_sum_odd:
  fixes a b::nat
  assumes "prime a" "prime b" "prime (a + b)"
  shows "odd (a + b)"
proof (rule ccontr)
  assume "\<not> odd (a + b)"
  then have "even (a + b)"
    by simp
  have "a \<noteq> 2"
  proof 
    assume "a = 2"
    then have "even a"
      by simp
    then show False
      using assms(1) prime_odd_int by (smt (verit) \<open>\<not> odd (a + b)\<close> \<open>a = 2\<close> add_eq_self_zero assms(2) assms(3) not_prime_0 prime_prime_factor two_is_prime_nat)
  qed
  have "b \<noteq> 2"
  proof 
    assume "b = 2"
    then have "even b"
      by simp
    then show False
      using assms(2) prime_odd_int by (metis \<open>\<not> odd (a + b)\<close> \<open>a \<noteq> 2\<close> \<open>b = 2\<close> assms(1) dvd_add_triv_right_iff prime_prime_factor)
  qed
  have "a > 2 \<and> b > 2"
    using assms(1,2) prime_gt_1_nat by (metis \<open>\<not> odd (a + b)\<close> add_strict_mono assms(3) less_not_refl nat_1_add_1 prime_nat_iff' prime_prime_factor two_is_prime_nat)
  then have "odd a \<and> odd b"
    using assms(1,2) \<open>a \<noteq> 2\<close> \<open>b \<noteq> 2\<close> prime_odd_int by (metis prime_odd_nat)
  then obtain k1 k2 where "a = 2 * k1 + 1" "b = 2 * k2 + 1"
    using oddE by (metis add.commute add.left_commute left_add_twice mult_2)
  then have "a + b = 2 * (k1 + k2 + 1)"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then have "even (a + b)"
    by simp
  then show False
    using \<open>even (a + b)\<close> \<open>\<not> odd (a + b)\<close> by (smt (verit) \<open>2 < a \<and> 2 < b\<close> assms(3) not_add_less2 prime_prime_factor two_is_prime_nat)
qed

lemma substitution_and_arithmetic:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "a \<noteq> b"
  shows "(a^2 + b^2) / (a - b) - (a - b) = 2 * a * b / (a - b)"
proof -
  have "(a^2 + b^2) / (a - b) - (a - b) = (a^2 + b^2 - (a - b)^2) / (a - b)"
    by sos
  also have "... = (a^2 + b^2 - (a^2 - 2 * a * b + b^2)) / (a - b)"
    by sos
  also have "... = (2 * a * b) / (a - b)"
    using assms by simp
  finally show ?thesis by auto
qed

theorem amc12_2000_p11:
  fixes a b::real
  assumes "a \<noteq> 0" "b \<noteq> 0"
      and "a * b = a - b"
    shows "a / b + b / a - a * b = 2"
proof -
  have "a / b + b / a - a * b = (a^2 + b^2) / (a * b) - (a - b)"
    using assms by sos
  also have "... = (a^2 + b^2) / (a - b) - (a - b)"
    using assms by auto
  also have "... = 2 * a * b / (a - b)"
    using substitution_and_arithmetic[where a="a" and b="b"] assms(3) by fastforce
  also have "... = 2" using assms by (metis mult.commute mult.left_commute nonzero_mult_div_cancel_left nonzero_mult_divide_mult_cancel_left2 times_divide_eq_right)
  finally show ?thesis by auto
qed

theorem amc12_2001_p2:
  fixes a b n::nat
  assumes "1 \<le> a \<and> a \<le> 9"
    and "0 \<le> b \<and> b \<le> 9"
    and "n = 10 * a + b"
    and "n = a * b + a + b"
  shows "b=9"
proof -
  have "n = 10 * a + b" using assms by simp
  moreover have "n = a * b + a + b" using assms by simp
  hence "10*a + b = a * b + a + b" using calculation by simp
  moreover have "9 * a = a * b" using calculation by simp
  ultimately have "9 = b" using assms by simp
  then show ?thesis by auto
qed

theorem amc12b_2003_p9:
  fixes a b ::real and f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes "\<forall> x. f x = a * x + b"
    and " f 6 - f 2 = 12"
  shows "f 12 - f 2 = 30"
proof -
  have c0: "\<And>x. f x = a * x + b" using assms by auto
  have c1: "a = 3" using assms(2) c0 by auto
  have "f 12 - f 2 = 3 * (12 - 2)" using c0 c1 by auto
  then show ?thesis by auto
qed

theorem amc12a_2009_p9:
  fixes a b c::real
    and f::"real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes h0:"\<forall> x. f (x+3) = 3 * x^2 + 7*x + 4"
    and h1:"\<forall> x. f x = a * x^2 + b * x + c"
  shows "a+b+c=2"
proof -
  have "f (-2+3) = 3 * (-2)^2 + 7 * (-2) + 4" using h0 by blast
  hence "f 1 = 3 * (-2)^2 + 7 * (-2) + 4" by simp
  also have "f 1 = a + b + c" using h1 by simp
  finally have "a + b + c = 2" by simp
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_126:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes h0 : "2 * 3 = x - 9"
    and h1 : "2 * (-5) = y + 1"
  shows "x=15 \<and> y = -11"
proof -
  have midpt: "(x+(-9))/2 = 3 \<and> (y+1)/2 = -5"
    using assms by simp
  have eq1: "(x+(-9))/2 = 3" using midpt by simp
  have eq2: "(y+1)/2 = -5" using midpt by simp
  have "x+(-9) = 2 * 3" using eq1 by simp
  then have "x = 15" by simp
  have "y+1 = 2 * (-5)" using eq2 by simp
  then have "y = -11" by simp
  then show ?thesis using \<open>x = 15\<close> by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_510:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes h0 : "x+y=13"
    and h1 : "x*y=24"
  shows "sqrt (x^2 + y^2) = 11"
proof -
  have "x^2 + y^2 = (x + y)^2 - 2 * x * y" by (simp add: algebra_simps power2_eq_square)
  also have "... = 13^2 - 2 * 24" using h0 h1 by simp
  also have "... = 169 - 48" by simp
  also have "... = 121" by simp
  finally have "x^2 + y^2 = 121" by simp
  then have "sqrt (x^2 + y^2) = sqrt 121" by simp
  also have "... = 11" by simp
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

         ((-b)/(2*a) + (sqrt(b^2 - 4*a*c))/(2*a), (-b)/(2*a) - (sqrt(b^2 - 4*a*c))/(2*a))"
proof -

theorem mathd_algebra_67:
  fixes f g :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes h0 : "\<And>x. f x = 5 * x + 3"
    and h1 : "\<And>x. g x = x^2 - 2"
  shows "g (f (-1)) = 2"

  then show ?thesis by auto
qed

theorem linear_equation:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes h0 : "a \<noteq> 0"
    and h1 : "a * x + b = c"
  shows "x = (c - b) / a"
proof -
  have "a * x = c - b" using h1 by simp
  then have "x = (c - b) / a" using h0 by (auto simp: field_simps)
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

  then show ?thesis
    by simp

theorem mathd_numbertheory_458:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes h0 : "n mod 8 = (7::nat)"
  shows "n mod 4 = 3"
proof -
  have "n = 8*(n div 8) + (n mod 8)" by arith
  also have "... = 8*(n div 8) + 7" using h0 by simp
  finally have c0: "n = 8*(n div 8) + 7" by auto
  have "n = 4*(2*(n div 8) + 1) + 3" using c0 by auto
  then have c1: "n mod 4 = 3" by presburger
  then show ?thesis using c1 by blast
qed

theorem absolute_value_less_than_x:
  fixes a x :: real
  assumes h0 : "1 / 5 * abs(x + a) < 1"
  shows "-x - 5 < a \<and> a < -x + 5"
proof -
  have c0: "abs(x + a) < 5"
    using h0 by simp
  have c1: "x + a < 5 \<or> -(x + a) < 5"
    using c0 by auto
  have c2: "x + a < 5 \<Longrightarrow> a < -x + 5"
    by simp
  have c3: "-(x + a) < 5 \<Longrightarrow> -x - 5 < a"
    by simp
  from c1 c2 c3 show ?thesis by (metis abs_less_iff c0 diff_numeral_special(10) minus_diff_commute mult_2 mult_minus_right numeral_times_minus_swap one_add_one)
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_245:
  fixes x :: real
  assumes h0 : "x \<noteq> 0"
  shows "1/(4/x) * ((3*x^3)/x)^2 * (1/(1 / (2 * x)))^3 = 18 * x^8"
proof -
  have "1/(4/x) = x/4"
    using assms by simp
  have "((3*x^3)/x)^2 = 9*x^4"
    using assms by (auto simp: field_simps)
  have "(1/(1 / (2 * x)))^3 = (2*x)^3"
    using assms by simp
  have "1/(4/x) * ((3*x^3)/x)^2 * (1/(1 / (2 * x)))^3 = (x/4) * (9*x^4) * (8*x^3)"
    using assms by (auto simp: field_simps)
  have "(x/4) * (9*x^4) * (8*x^3) = 18 * x^8"
    using assms by sos
  then show ?thesis
    by sos
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_10:
  "abs ((120::real) / 100 * 30 - 130 / 100 * 20) = 10"
proof -
  have "abs ((120::real) / 100 * 30 - 130 / 100 * 20) = abs (36 - 26)"
    by simp
  also have "... = 10"
    by simp
  finally show ?thesis
    by simp
qed

lemma distribute_division:
  fixes a b c x :: real
  assumes "x \<noteq> 0" "a + b / x = c"
  shows "a * x + b = c * x"
proof -
  have "x * (a + b / x) = c * x" using assms(2) by auto
  then have "x * a + x * (b / x) = c * x" by (simp add: distrib_left)
  then have "x * a + b = c * x" using assms(1) by (simp add: mult.commute)
  then show ?thesis by sos
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_159:
  fixes b :: real
    and f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes h0 : "\<And>x. f x = 3 * x^4 - 7 * x^3 + 2*x^2 - b*x +1"
    and h1 : "f 1 = 1"
  shows "b = -2"
proof -
  have "f 1 = 3 * 1^4 - 7 * 1^3 + 2*1^2 - b*1 +1" using h0 by simp
  also have "... = 3 - 7 + 2 - b + 1" by simp
  also have "... = -b -1" by simp
  finally have "f 1 = -b -1" by simp
  then have "-b -1 = 1" using h1 by simp
  then have "-b = 2" by simp
  then have "b = -2" by simp
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_89:
  fixes b :: real
  assumes h0 : "b\<noteq>0"
  shows "(7 * b^3)^2 * 1/((4 * b^2)^3) = 49 / 64"
proof -
  have c0: "(7 * b^3)^2 = 49 * b^6"
    by (simp add: power_mult_distrib)
  have c1: "(4 * b^2)^3 = 64 * b^6"
    by (simp add: power_mult_distrib)
  have "(7 * b^3)^2 * 1/((4 * b^2)^3) = (49 * b^6) * (1/(64 * b^6))"
    using c0 c1 by simp
  have "(49 * b^6) * (1/(64 * b^6)) = 49/64"
    using h0 by auto
  then show ?thesis by auto
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_43:
  fixes a b :: real
    and f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes h0 : "\<And>x. f x = a * x + b"
    and h1 : "f 7 = 4"
    and h2 : "f 6 = 3"
  shows "f 3 = 0"
proof -
  have "a = (f 7 - f 6) / (7 - 6)" using assms by simp
  then have "a = 1" using assms by simp
  have "f x = x + b" using h0 \<open>a = 1\<close> by simp
  have "f x = 0 \<longleftrightarrow> x + b = 0" using \<open>f x = x + b\<close> by simp
  have "f 3 = 0 \<longleftrightarrow> 3 + b = 0" using \<open>f x = 0 \<longleftrightarrow> x + b = 0\<close> by (metis \<open>a = 1\<close> add.commute comm_monoid_mult_class.mult_1 h0 semiring_norm(3))
  then have "f 3 = 0" using assms by simp
  then show ?thesis by auto
qed

lemma mod_add_power:
  fixes x n a b c :: nat
  assumes "n > 0" "b > 0" "c > 0" "x mod n = a"
  shows "((x + b)^c) mod n = ((a + b)^c) mod n"

  finally show ?thesis by auto

theorem mathd_algebra_132:

    and f g :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes h0 : "\<And>x. f x = x + 2"
    and h1 : "\<And>x. g x = x^2"
    and h2 : "f (g x) = g (f x)"

proof -

lemma solve_for_k:
  fixes k x :: real
  assumes h0: "x = (13 - sqrt 131) / 4"
    and h1: "2 * x^2 - 13 * x + k = 0"
  shows "k = 19/4"
proof -
  have "2 * x^2 - 13 * x + k = 0"
    using h1 by simp
  then have "2 * ((13 - sqrt 131) / 4)^2 - 13 * ((13 - sqrt 131) / 4) + k = 0"
    using h0 by simp
  then have "2 * ((13 - sqrt 131)^2 / 4^2) - 13 * ((13 - sqrt 131) / 4) + k = 0"
    by (simp add: power2_eq_square)
  then have "2 * (13 - sqrt 131)^2 / 16 - 13 * ((13 - sqrt 131) / 4) + k = 0"
    by simp
  then have "2 * (13 - sqrt 131)^2 - 13 * ((13 - sqrt 131) * 4) + 16 * k = 0"
    by arith
  then have "2 * (13 - sqrt 131)^2 - 52 * (13 - sqrt 131) + 16 * k = 0"
    by simp
  then have "2 * (13^2 - 2 * 13 * sqrt 131 + (sqrt 131)^2) - 52 * (13 - sqrt 131) + 16 * k = 0"
    by (smt (verit) diff_add_eq power2_diff)
  then have "2 * (169 - 26 * sqrt 131 + 131) - 52 * (13 - sqrt 131) + 16 * k = 0"
    by simp
  then have "2 * (169 + 131 - 26 * sqrt 131) - 52 * (13 - sqrt 131) + 16 * k = 0"
    by simp
  then have "2 * (300 - 26 * sqrt 131) - 52 * (13 - sqrt 131) + 16 * k = 0"
    by simp
  then have "2 * 300 - 2 * 26 * sqrt 131 - 52 * 13 + 52 * sqrt 131 + 16 * k = 0"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then have "600 - 52 * 13 + 16 * k = 0"
    by simp
  then have "600 - 676 + 16 * k = 0"
    by simp
  then have "-76 + 16 * k = 0"
    by simp
  then have "16 * k = 76"
    by simp
  then have "k = 76 / 16"
    by simp
  then have "k = 19/4"
    by simp
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_192:
  fixes q e d :: complex
  assumes h0 : "q = Complex 11 (-5)"
    and h1 : "e = Complex 11 5"
    and h2 : "d = Complex 0 2"
  shows "q * e * d = Complex 0 292"
proof -

    using assms by auto
  have e_def: "e = Complex 11 5"
    using assms by auto
  have d_def: "d = Complex 0 2"

    by (simp add: complex_eq_iff)
  also have "... = (Complex (121 + 25) (55 - 55)) * (Complex 0 2)"
    by simp
  also have "... = Complex 146 0 * Complex 0 2"
    by simp
  also have "... = Complex 0 (292)"
    by eval
  finally have "q * e * d = Complex 0 (292)"
    by simp
  then show ?thesis
    by simp
qed

theorem algebra_2varlineareq_xpeeq7_2xpeeq3_eeq11_xeqn4:

qed

theorem amc12_2001_p2:
  fixes a b n::nat
  assumes "1 \<le> a \<and> a \<le> 9"
    and "0 \<le> b \<and> b \<le> 9"
    and "n = 10 * a + b"
    and "n = a * b + a + b"
  shows "b=9"
proof -
  have "n = 10 * a + b" using assms by simp
  moreover have "n = a * b + a + b" using assms by simp
  hence "10*a + b = a * b + a + b" using calculation by simp
  moreover have "9 * a = a * b" using calculation by simp
  ultimately have "9 = b" using assms by simp
  then show ?thesis by auto
qed

    and f g :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"

theorem mathd_algebra_234:
  fixes d :: real
  assumes h0 : "27/125 * d = 9/25"
  shows "3/5 * d^3 = 25/9"

  hence "27/125 * d * (5/3)^2 = 9/25 * (5/3)^2" using assms by auto
  hence "27/125 * d * (5/3)^3 = 9/25 * (5/3)^3" using assms by auto
  then show ?thesis by sos
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_421:
  fixes a b c d :: real
  assumes h0 : "b = a^2 + 4 * a + 6"
    and h1 : "b = 1 / 2 * a^2 + a + 6"
    and h2 : "d = c^2 + 4 * c + 6"
    and h3 : "d = 1 / 2 * c^2 + c + 6"
    and h4 : "a < c"
  shows "c-a=6"
proof -
  have c0: "a^2 + 4 * a + 6 = 1 / 2 * a^2 + a + 6 \<and> c^2 + 4 * c + 6 = 1 / 2 * c^2 + c + 6 \<and> a < c"
    using h0 h1 h2 h3 h4
    by auto
  have c1: "1 / 2 * a^2 + 3 * a = 0" using c0
    by auto
  have c2: "a * (1 / 2 * a + 3) = 0" using c1
    by sos
  have c3: "a = 0 \<or> a = -6" using c2
    by auto
  have c4: "c = 0 \<and> a = -6" using c3 c0
    by sos
  have "c - a = 0 - (-6)" using c4
    by auto
  then show "c - a = 6" by auto
qed

lemma mod_add_power:
  fixes x n a b c :: nat
  assumes "n > 0" "b > 0" "c > 0" "x mod n = a"
  shows "((x + b)^c) mod n = ((a + b)^c) mod n"
proof -

    by (smt (verit) mod_add_left_eq power_mod)

theorem mathd_algebra_43:
  fixes a b :: real
    and f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes h0 : "\<And>x. f x = a * x + b"
    and h1 : "f 7 = 4"
    and h2 : "f 6 = 3"
  shows "f 3 = 0"
proof -
  have "a = (f 7 - f 6) / (7 - 6)" using assms by simp
  then have "a = 1" using assms by simp
  have "f x = x + b" using h0 \<open>a = 1\<close> by simp
  have "f x = 0 \<longleftrightarrow> x + b = 0" using \<open>f x = x + b\<close> by simp
  have "f 3 = 0 \<longleftrightarrow> 3 + b = 0" using \<open>f x = 0 \<longleftrightarrow> x + b = 0\<close> by (metis \<open>a = 1\<close> add.commute comm_monoid_mult_class.mult_1 h0 semiring_norm(3))
  then have "f 3 = 0" using assms by simp
  then show ?thesis by auto
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_214:
  fixes a :: real
    and f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes h0 : "\<And>x. f x = a * (x-2)^2 + 3"
    and h1 : "f 4 = 4"
  shows "f 6 = 7"
proof -
  have "f x = a * (x-2)^2 + 3" using h0 by auto
  then have "4 = a * (4-2)^2 + 3" using h1 by (metis h0)
  then have "a = 1/4" by simp
  then have "f 6 = 1/4 * (6-2)^2 + 3" using h0 by simp
  then have "f 6 = 7" by simp
  then show "f 6 = 7" by auto
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_67:
  fixes f g :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes h0 : "\<And>x. f x = 5 * x + 3"
    and h1 : "\<And>x. g x = x^2 - 2"
  shows "g (f (-1)) = 2"
proof -
  have "f (-1) = 5 * (-1) + 3" using h0 by simp
  hence "g (f (-1)) = g (5 * (-1) + 3)" by simp
  hence "g (f (-1)) = g 2" by (smt (z3) \<open>f (- 1) = 5 * - 1 + 3\<close> h1 one_plus_BitM power2_eq_iff)
  then show ?thesis using h1 by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_616:
  fixes f g :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes h0 : "\<And>x. f x = x^3 + 2 * x + 1"
    and h1 : "\<And>x. g x = x - 1"
  shows "f (g 1) = 1"
proof -
  have "f (g 1) = f (1 - 1)" using h1 by simp
  also have "... = 0^3 + 2 * 0 + 1" using h0 by simp
  also have "... = 0 + 0 + 1" by simp
  also have "... = 1" by simp
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_numbertheory_370:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes h0 : "n mod 7 = (3::nat)"
  shows "(2*n+1) mod 7 = (0::nat)"
proof -
  have "n = 7 * (n div 7) + (n mod 7)" by arith
  also have "... = 7 * (n div 7) + 3" using h0 by simp
  finally have c0: "n = 7 * (n div 7) + 3" by auto
  have "(2*n+1) = 2*(7*(n div 7) + 3) + 1" using c0 by simp
  then have c1: "(2*n+1) = 14*(n div 7) + 7" by simp
  have "(2*n+1) = 14*(n div 7) + 7" using c1 by simp
  then have "(2*n+1) = 7*(2*(n div 7)) + 7" by simp
  then have "(2*n+1) = 7*((2*(n div 7)) + 1)" by simp
  then have "(2*n+1) = 7*(2*(n div 7) + 1)" by simp
  then have c2: "(2*n+1) = 7*((2*n+1) div 7)" by simp
  have "(2*n+1) = 7*((2*n+1) div 7)" using c2 by simp
  then have c3: "(2*n+1) mod 7 = 0" by presburger
  then show ?thesis using c3 by blast
qed

  fixes q e :: complex

proof -

qed

lemma mathd_algebra_206_helper:
  fixes a b :: real
    and f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes h0 : "\<And>x. f x = x^2 + a*x + b"
    and h1 : "2 * a \<noteq> b"
    and h2 : "f (2 * a) = 0"
    and h3 : "f b = 0"
  shows "a + b = -1"
proof -
  have "f (2 * a) = (2 * a)^2 + a * (2 * a) + b" using h0 by simp
  then have "4 * a^2 + 2 * a^2 + b = 0" by (smt (verit) h2 mult.commute mult_2 power2_diff power2_eq_square ring_class.ring_distribs(2) zero_power2)
  then have "6 * a^2 + b = 0" by simp
  have "f b = b^2 + a * b + b" using h0 by simp
  then have "b^2 + a * b + b = 0" using h3 by simp
  then have "b * (b + a + 1) = 0" by sos
  then have "b = 0 \<or> b + a + 1 = 0" by simp
  moreover {
    assume "b = 0"
    then have "a + b = a" by simp
    then have "a + b = -1" using h1 by (smt (verit) \<open>4 * a\<^sup>2 + 2 * a\<^sup>2 + b = 0\<close> \<open>b = 0\<close> \<open>f (2 * a) = (2 * a)\<^sup>2 + a * (2 * a) + b\<close> \<open>f b = b\<^sup>2 + a * b + b\<close> add.inverse_neutral add_cancel_left_left add_eq_0_iff add_le_same_cancel2 four_x_squared h2 h3 power2_less_eq_zero_iff)
  }
  moreover {
    assume "b + a + 1 = 0"
    then have "a + b = -1" by simp
  }
  ultimately show ?thesis by blast
qed

lemma mathd_algebra_206_helper:
  fixes a b :: real
    and f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes h0 : "\<And>x. f x = x^2 + a*x + b"
    and h1 : "2 * a \<noteq> b"
    and h2 : "f (2 * a) = 0"
    and h3 : "f b = 0"
  shows "a + b = -1"
proof -
  have "f (2 * a) = (2 * a)^2 + a * (2 * a) + b" using h0 by simp
  then have "(2 * a)^2 + a * (2 * a) + b = 0" using h2 by simp
  then have "4 * a^2 + 2 * a^2 + b = 0" by sos
  then have "b = -6 * a^2" using h1 by simp
  have "f b = b^2 + a * b + b" using h0 by simp
  then have "b^2 + a * b + b = 0" using h3 by simp
  then have "b * (b + a + 1) = 0" by sos
  then have "b + a + 1 = 0" using \<open>b = -6 * a^2\<close> by (smt (verit) \<open>(2 * a)\<^sup>2 + a * (2 * a) + b = 0\<close> \<open>4 * a\<^sup>2 + 2 * a\<^sup>2 + b = 0\<close> \<open>b\<^sup>2 + a * b + b = 0\<close> add_cancel_right_left add_le_same_cancel2 add_right_imp_eq four_x_squared h1 minus_add_cancel no_zero_divisors power2_less_eq_zero_iff real_add_le_0_iff zero_le_power_eq_numeral zero_power2)
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma mathd_algebra_131_helper:
  fixes a b :: real
    and f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes h0 : "\<And>x. f x = 2 * x^2 - 7 * x + 2"
    and h1 : "f a = 0"
    and h2 : "f b = 0"
    and h3 : "a \<noteq> b"
  shows "(a+b)-2 = 7/2 - 2"
proof -
  have "f a = 2 * a^2 - 7 * a + 2" using h0 by simp
  then have "2 * a^2 - 7 * a + 2 = 0" using h1 by simp
  have "f b = 2 * b^2 - 7 * b + 2" using h0 by simp
  then have "2 * b^2 - 7 * b + 2 = 0" using h2 by simp
  have "a^2 - b^2 = (a-b) * (a+b)" by sos
  then have "(a-b) * (a+b) = (7 * (a - b)) / 2" using \<open>2 * a^2 - 7 * a + 2 = 0\<close> \<open>2 * b^2 - 7 * b + 2 = 0\<close> by simp
  then have "(a+b) * (a-b) = (7 * (a - b)) / 2" by sos
  then have "a+b = (7 * (a - b)) / (2 * (a-b))" using h3 by (auto simp: field_simps)
  then have "a+b = 7/2" using h3 by sos
  then have "(a+b) - 2 = (7/2) - 2" by simp
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_126:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes h0 : "2 * 3 = x - 9"
    and h1 : "2 * (-5) = y + 1"
  shows "x=15 \<and> y = -11"
proof -
  have midpt: "(x+(-9))/2 = 3 \<and> (y+1)/2 = -5"
    using assms by simp
  have eq1: "(x+(-9))/2 = 3" using midpt by simp
  have eq2: "(y+1)/2 = -5" using midpt by simp
  have "x+(-9) = 2 * 3" using eq1 by simp
  then have "x = 15" by simp
  have "y+1 = 2 * (-5)" using eq2 by simp
  then have "y = -11" by simp
  then show ?thesis using \<open>x = 15\<close> by simp
qed

lemma subst:
  fixes f::"real \<Rightarrow> real"
    and a b c::real
  assumes "\<forall> x. f (x+3) = 3 * x^2 + 7*x + 4"
    and "\<forall> x. f x = a * x^2 + b * x + c"

proof -

    by simp
  also have "... = 3 * (-2)^2 + 7 * (-2) + 4" 
    using assms(1) by blast
  also have "... = 12 - 14 + 4" 
    by simp
  finally have "f 1 = 2" 
    by simp

    by (metis add.commute add.left_commute add_left_imp_eq assms(2) group_cancel.add2 mult.comm_neutral neg_equal_iff_equal one_add_one power2_eq_1_iff ring_class.ring_distribs(2))

qed

theorem mathd_algebra_104:
  fixes x :: real
  assumes h0 : "125/8 = x /12"

proof -

theorem mathd_algebra_192:

theorem mathd_numbertheory_458:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes h0 : "n mod 8 = (7::nat)"
  shows "n mod 4 = 3"
proof -
  have "n = 8*(n div 8) + (n mod 8)" by arith
  also have "... = 8*(n div 8) + 7" using h0 by simp
  finally have c0: "n = 8*(n div 8) + 7" by auto
  have "n = 4*(2*(n div 8) + 1) + 3" using c0 by auto
  then have c1: "n mod 4 = 3" by presburger
  then show ?thesis using c1 by blast
qed

theorem induction_sum2kp1npqsqm1:
  fixes n :: nat 
  shows "(\<Sum> k<n. 2 * k + 3) = (n + 1)^2 - 1"
proof (induction n)
  case 0
  then show ?case by simp
next
  case (Suc n)
  then have "(\<Sum> k<Suc n. 2 * k + 3) = (\<Sum> k<n. 2 * k + 3) + (2 * n + 3)" by simp
  also have "... = (n + 1)^2 - 1 + (2 * n + 3)" using Suc.IH by simp
  also have "... = n^2 + 2 * n + 1 - 1 + 2 * n + 3" by (simp add: power2_eq_square)
  also have "... = n^2 + 4 * n + 3" by simp
  also have "... = (n + 2)^2 - 1" by (simp add: power2_eq_square)
  finally show ?case by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_422:
  fixes x :: real and \<sigma>::"real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes "bij \<sigma>"
    and \<sigma>:"\<forall> x. \<sigma> x = 5 * x - 12"
    and "\<sigma> (x + 1) = (Hilbert_Choice.inv \<sigma>) x" 
  shows "x = 47 / 24"
proof -
  have "((Hilbert_Choice.inv \<sigma>) \<circ> \<sigma>) x = (\<lambda> x. 5 * x - 12) ((Hilbert_Choice.inv \<sigma>) x)" 
    using \<sigma> by (metis assms(1) bij_inv_eq_iff comp_apply)
  then have "x = 5 * (Hilbert_Choice.inv \<sigma>) x - 12" 
    using assms(1) bij_def by (metis \<sigma> bij_inv_eq_iff)
  then have "x + 12 = 5 * (Hilbert_Choice.inv \<sigma>) x" 
    by auto
  then have "(Hilbert_Choice.inv \<sigma>) x = (x + 12) / 5" 
    by auto
  then have "(x + 12) / 5 = 5 * (x + 1) - 12" 
    using assms(3) by (metis \<sigma> semiring_norm(5))
  then have "x + 12 = 25 * x - 35" 
    by auto
  then have "24 * x = 47" 
    by auto
  then have "x = 47 / 24" 
    by auto
  then show ?thesis by auto
qed

lemma algebra_sqineq_2xyxysq:

theorem algebra_sqineq_36azm9asqle36zsq:
  fixes z a :: real
  shows "36 * (a * z) - 9 * a^2 \<le> 36 * z^2"
proof -
  have c1: "36 * (a * z) - 9 * a^2 = 2 * (3 * a) * (6 * z) - (3 * a)^2"
    by (simp add: power2_eq_square)
  have c2: "2 * (3 * a) * (6 * z) \<le> (3 * a)^2 + (6 * z)^2"
    using algebra_sqineq_2xyxysq[of "3 * a" "6 * z"] by simp
  have c3: "(3 * a)^2 + (6 * z)^2 \<ge> 2 * (3 * a) * (6 * z)"
    using algebra_sqineq_2xyxysq[of "3 * a" "6 * z"]
    by simp
  have "2 * (3 * a) * (6 * z) \<le> (3 * a)^2 + (6 * z)^2"
    using c2 c3 by simp
  then have "36 * (a * z) - 9 * a^2 \<le> 36 * z^2"
    using c1 by simp
  then show ?thesis 
    by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_132:

    and f g :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes h0 : "\<And>x. f x = x + 2"
    and h1 : "\<And>x. g x = x^2"
    and h2 : "f (g x) = g (f x)"
  shows "x = -1/2"

  then show "x = -1/2"
    by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_126:

  assumes h0 : "2 * 3 = x - 9"
    and h1 : "2 * (-5) = y + 1"

    using assms by simp

  have eq2: "(y+1)/2 = -5" using midpt by simp
  have "x+(-9) = 2 * 3" using eq1 by simp

theorem mathd_algebra_267:
  fixes x :: real
  assumes h0 : "x \<noteq> 1"
    and h1 : "x \<noteq> -2"
    and h2 : "(x + 1) / (x - 1) = (x - 2) / (x + 2)"
  shows "x=0"
proof -
  have "(x + 1) * (x + 2) = (x - 2) * (x - 1)" 
    using cross_mult[of "x + 1" "x - 1" "x - 2" "x + 2"] h2 by (smt (verit) frac_eq_eq h0 h1)
  then have "x^2 + 3 * x + 2 = x^2 - 3 * x + 2" 
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then have "3 * x = -3 * x" 
    by simp
  then have "6 * x = 0" 
    by simp
  then have "x = 0" 
    by simp
  then show ?thesis .
qed

  have c1: "3 = 7/x - 1/x" using c0 by simp
  have c2: "3 = 6/x" using c1 by simp
  have c3: "x = 6/3" using c2 by (smt (verit) divide_divide_eq_right nonzero_mult_div_cancel_left)
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_510:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes h0 : "x+y=13"
    and h1 : "x*y=24"
  shows "sqrt (x^2 + y^2) = 11"
proof -
  have "x^2 + y^2 = (x + y)^2 - 2 * x * y" by (simp add: algebra_simps power2_eq_square)
  also have "... = 13^2 - 2 * 24" using h0 h1 by simp
  also have "... = 169 - 48" by simp
  also have "... = 121" by simp
  finally have "x^2 + y^2 = 121" by simp
  then have "sqrt (x^2 + y^2) = sqrt 121" by simp
  also have "... = 11" by simp
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_126:

  assumes h0 : "2 * 3 = x - 9"
    and h1 : "2 * (-5) = y + 1"

proof -
  have midpt: "(x+(-9))/2 = 3 \<and> (y+1)/2 = -5"
    using assms by simp
  have eq1: "(x+(-9))/2 = 3" using midpt by simp
  have eq2: "(y+1)/2 = -5" using midpt by simp
  have "x+(-9) = 2 * 3" using eq1 by simp
  then have "x = 15" by simp

  then have "y = -11" by simp
  then show ?thesis using \<open>x = 15\<close> by simp
qed

lemma quadratic_formula:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "a \<noteq> 0"
  and "b^2 \<ge> 4*a*c"
  shows "((-b + sqrt(b^2 - 4*a*c))/(2*a), (-b - sqrt(b^2 - 4*a*c))/(2*a)) = 
         ((-b)/(2*a) + (sqrt(b^2 - 4*a*c))/(2*a), (-b)/(2*a) - (sqrt(b^2 - 4*a*c))/(2*a))"
proof -
  have "((-b + sqrt(b^2 - 4*a*c))/(2*a), (-b - sqrt(b^2 - 4*a*c))/(2*a)) = 
        ((-b)/(2*a) + (sqrt(b^2 - 4*a*c))/(2*a), (-b)/(2*a) - (sqrt(b^2 - 4*a*c))/(2*a))"
    by (smt (verit) add_divide_distrib diff_divide_distrib)
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

  shows "f 6 = 7"
proof -
  have "f x = a * (x-2)^2 + 3" using h0 by auto

  then have "a = 1/4" by simp

theorem mathd_algebra_422:
  fixes x :: real and \<sigma>::"real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes "bij \<sigma>"
    and \<sigma>:"\<forall> x. \<sigma> x = 5 * x - 12"
    and "\<sigma> (x + 1) = (Hilbert_Choice.inv \<sigma>) x" 
  shows "x = 47 / 24"
proof -
  have "((Hilbert_Choice.inv \<sigma>) \<circ> \<sigma>) x = (\<lambda> x. 5 * x - 12) ((Hilbert_Choice.inv \<sigma>) x)" 
    using \<sigma> by (metis assms(1) bij_inv_eq_iff comp_apply)
  then have "x = 5 * (Hilbert_Choice.inv \<sigma>) x - 12" 
    using assms(1) bij_def by (metis \<sigma> bij_inv_eq_iff)
  then have "x + 12 = 5 * (Hilbert_Choice.inv \<sigma>) x" 
    by auto
  then have "(Hilbert_Choice.inv \<sigma>) x = (x + 12) / 5" 
    by auto
  then have "(x + 12) / 5 = 5 * (x + 1) - 12" 
    using assms(3) by (metis \<sigma> semiring_norm(5))
  then have "x + 12 = 25 * x - 35" 
    by auto
  then have "24 * x = 47" 
    by auto
  then have "x = 47 / 24" 
    by auto
  then show ?thesis by auto
qed

qed

theorem mathd_algebra_192:
  fixes q e d :: complex
  assumes h0 : "q = Complex 11 (-5)"
    and h1 : "e = Complex 11 5"

  shows "q * e * d = Complex 0 292"
proof -

    using assms by auto
  have e_def: "e = Complex 11 5"
    using assms by auto
  have d_def: "d = Complex 0 2"
    using assms by auto
  have "q * e * d = (Complex 11 (-5)) * (Complex 11 5) * (Complex 0 2)"
    using q_def e_def d_def by simp
  also have "... = (Complex (11 * 11 - (-5) * 5) (11 * 5 + (-5) * 11)) * (Complex 0 2)"
    by (simp add: complex_eq_iff)
  also have "... = (Complex (121 + 25) (55 - 55)) * (Complex 0 2)"
    by simp
  also have "... = Complex 146 0 * Complex 0 2"
    by simp
  also have "... = Complex 0 (292)"
    by eval
  finally have "q * e * d = Complex 0 (292)"
    by simp
  then show ?thesis
    by simp
qed

    by simp

qed

theorem mathd_algebra_214:

    and f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"

proof -

  then have "f 6 = 1/4 * (6-2)^2 + 3" using h0 by simp

  then show "f 6 = 7" by auto
qed

    and f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"

    and h1 : "f 7 = 4"

  have "f x = 0 \<longleftrightarrow> x + b = 0" using \<open>f x = x + b\<close> by simp

  assumes "j>0"
  shows "(3 * (7 * j + 3)) mod 7 = 2"
proof -

  then have "(3 * (7 * j + 3)) = 7 * (3 * j) + 7 * (9/7)" 
    by (simp add: distrib_left)

lemma evaluation_of_composite_functions:
  fixes p q :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes "\<And>x. p x = 2 - x^2"
    and "\<And>x. (x\<noteq>0) \<Longrightarrow> q x = 6 / x"
    and "x \<noteq> 0"
  shows "p (q x) = 2 - (6 / x)^2"
proof -

    using assms(1) by auto
  also have "... = 2 - (6 / x)^2"
    using assms(2) assms(3) by auto
  finally show ?thesis by auto
qed

    using c0 by simp
  also have "... = 2 - (6/2)^2"

  also have "... = -7" by auto
  finally show ?thesis by auto
qed

lemma vieta_4:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "a+b+c = -3"
    and "a*b + b*c + c*a = 4"
    and "a*b*c = 11"
  shows "a^2 + b^2 + c^2 = 23"
proof -
  have "(a + b + c)^2 = (a^2 + b^2 + c^2) + 2*(a*b + b*c + c*a)" by sos
  also have "... = (a^2 + b^2 + c^2) + 2*4" using assms by simp
  also have "... = a^2 + b^2 + c^2 + 8" by simp
  finally have eq1: "(a + b + c)^2 = a^2 + b^2 + c^2 + 8" .
  have "(a + b + c)^2 = (-3)^2" using assms by simp
  also have "... = 9" by simp
  finally have eq2: "(a + b + c)^2 = 9" .
  from eq1 and eq2 have "a^2 + b^2 + c^2 + 8 = 9" by simp
  then have "a^2 + b^2 + c^2 = 9 - 8" by simp
  thus ?thesis by (smt (verit) add.commute assms(2) power2_diff power2_sum ring_class.ring_distribs(2) sum_squares_bound)
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_245:
  fixes x :: real
  assumes h0 : "x \<noteq> 0"
  shows "1/(4/x) * ((3*x^3)/x)^2 * (1/(1 / (2 * x)))^3 = 18 * x^8"
proof -
  have "1/(4/x) = x/4"
    using assms by simp
  have "((3*x^3)/x)^2 = 9*x^4"
    using assms by (auto simp: field_simps)
  have "(1/(1 / (2 * x)))^3 = (2*x)^3"
    using assms by simp
  have "1/(4/x) * ((3*x^3)/x)^2 * (1/(1 / (2 * x)))^3 = (x/4) * (9*x^4) * (8*x^3)"
    using assms by (auto simp: field_simps)

theorem mathd_algebra_132:

    and f g :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"

  shows "x = -1/2"

    using assms by simp

  then have "4*x = -2"
    by simp
  then have "x = -1/2"
    by simp
  then show "x = -1/2"
    by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_110:
  fixes q e :: complex
  assumes h0 : "q = Complex 2 (-2)"
    and h1 : "e = Complex 5 5"
  shows "q * e = 20"
proof -
  have "q * e = (Complex 2 (-2)) * (Complex 5 5)"
    using assms by simp
  also have "... = Complex (2 * 5 - (-2) * 5) ((-2) * 5 + 2 * 5)"
    by eval
  also have "... = Complex (10 + 10) ((-10) + 10)"
    by simp
  also have "... = Complex 20 0"
    by simp
  finally show ?thesis
    by (smt (verit) Complex_eq_numeral \<open>Complex 2 (- 2) * Complex 5 5 = Complex (2 * 5 - - 2 * 5) (- 2 * 5 + 2 * 5)\<close> \<open>q * e = Complex 2 (- 2) * Complex 5 5\<close> diff_numeral_special(3) diff_numeral_special(8) numeral_Bit0 numeral_Bit1 semiring_norm(2) sub_num_simps(1))
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_433:
  fixes f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes h0 : "\<And>x. f x = 3 * sqrt (2 * x -7) - 8"
  shows "f 8 = 1"
proof -
  have "f 8 = 3 * sqrt (2 * 8 - 7) - 8"
    using h0 by simp
  also have "... = 3 * sqrt (16 - 7) - 8"
    by simp
  also have "... = 3 * sqrt 9 - 8"
    by simp
  also have "... = 3 * 3 - 8"
    by simp
  also have "... = 1"
    by simp
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_245:
  fixes x :: real
  assumes h0 : "x \<noteq> 0"
  shows "1/(4/x) * ((3*x^3)/x)^2 * (1/(1 / (2 * x)))^3 = 18 * x^8"
proof -
  let ?a = "1/(4/x)"
  let ?b = "((3*x^3)/x)^2"
  let ?c = "1/(1 / (2 * x))^3"
  let ?d = "18 * x^8"
  have "?a = x/4"
    using assms by simp
  have "?b = 9*x^4"
    using assms by (auto simp: field_simps)
  have "?c = (2*x)^3"
    using assms by (auto simp: field_simps)
  have "?a * ?b * ?c = (x/4) * (9*x^4) * (8*x^3)"
    using assms by (auto simp: field_simps)
  have "?a * ?b * ?c = ?d"
    using assms by sos
  then show ?thesis
    by (auto simp: field_simps)
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_43:
  fixes a b :: real
    and f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes h0 : "\<And>x. f x = a * x + b"
    and h1 : "f 7 = 4"
    and h2 : "f 6 = 3"
  shows "f 3 = 0"
proof -
  have "a = (f 7 - f 6) / (7 - 6)" using assms by simp
  then have "a = 1" using assms by simp
  have "f x = x + b" using h0 \<open>a = 1\<close> by simp
  have "f x = 0 \<longleftrightarrow> x + b = 0" using \<open>f x = x + b\<close> by simp
  have "f 3 = 0 \<longleftrightarrow> 3 + b = 0" using \<open>f x = 0 \<longleftrightarrow> x + b = 0\<close> by (metis \<open>a = 1\<close> add.commute comm_monoid_mult_class.mult_1 h0 semiring_norm(3))
  then have "f 3 = 0" using assms by simp
  then show ?thesis by auto
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_159:
  fixes b :: real
    and f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes h0 : "\<And>x. f x = 3 * x^4 - 7 * x^3 + 2*x^2 - b*x +1"
    and h1 : "f 1 = 1"
  shows "b = -2"
proof -
  have "f 1 = 3 * 1^4 - 7 * 1^3 + 2*1^2 - b*1 +1" using h0 by simp
  also have "... = 3 - 7 + 2 - b + 1" by simp
  also have "... = -b -1" by simp
  finally have "f 1 = -b -1" by simp
  then have "-b -1 = 1" using h1 by simp
  then have "-b = 2" by simp
  then have "b = -2" by simp
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

  assumes "a > 0" "b > 0" "c > 0" "a \<noteq> 1"

  by (simp add: assms log_def)

lemma log_powr_properties:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "a > 0" "b > 0" "c > 0"
  shows "log a (b powr c) = c * log a b"
proof -
  have "log a (b powr c) = log a (exp (c * ln b))" using assms
    by (simp add: powr_def)
  also have "... = c * ln b / ln a" using assms
    by (simp add: log_def)
  also have "... = c * log a b" using assms
    by (simp add: log_def)
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma log_multiply:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes "x > 0" "y > 0"
  shows "ln (x * y) = ln x + ln y"

lemma log_diff:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "a > 0" "b > 0" "c > 0"
  shows "(ln a - ln b) + (ln b - ln c) + (ln c - ln a) = 0"
proof -
  have "(ln a - ln b) + (ln b - ln c) + (ln c - ln a) = ln a - ln a + ln b - ln b + ln c - ln c"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  also have "... = 0" by simp
  finally show ?thesis .
qed

  fixes x a b c:: real
  assumes "x > 0" "a + b / x = c"
  shows "a * x + b = c * x"
proof -
  have "x * (a + b / x) = c * x"

  then have "x * a + x * (b / x) = c * x"

theorem mathd_numbertheory_370:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes h0 : "n mod 7 = (3::nat)"
  shows "(2*n+1) mod 7 = (0::nat)"
proof -
  have "n = 7 * (n div 7) + (n mod 7)" by arith
  also have "... = 7 * (n div 7) + 3" using h0 by simp
  finally have c0: "n = 7 * (n div 7) + 3" by auto
  have "(2*n+1) = 2*(7*(n div 7) + 3) + 1" using c0 by simp
  then have c1: "(2*n+1) = 14*(n div 7) + 7" by simp
  have "(2*n+1) = 14*(n div 7) + 7" using c1 by simp
  then have "(2*n+1) = 7*(2*(n div 7)) + 7" by simp
  then have "(2*n+1) = 7*((2*(n div 7)) + 1)" by simp
  then have "(2*n+1) = 7*(2*(n div 7) + 1)" by simp
  then have c2: "(2*n+1) = 7*((2*n+1) div 7)" by simp
  have "(2*n+1) = 7*((2*n+1) div 7)" using c2 by simp
  then have c3: "(2*n+1) mod 7 = 0" by presburger
  then show ?thesis using c3 by blast
qed

theorem mathd_numbertheory_370:

proof -

  then have c2: "(2*n+1) = 7*((2*n+1) div 7)" by simp
  have "(2*n+1) = 7*((2*n+1) div 7)" using c2 by simp

lemma prime_power_factorial:
  fixes n p :: nat
  assumes "prime p"
    and "n > 0"
  shows "p ^ multiplicity p (fact n) dvd fact n"
proof -
  have "p ^ multiplicity p (fact n) dvd (\<Prod>i=1..n. i)"
    by (smt (verit) add.commute add_decreasing2 add_increasing2 assms(2) div_eq_dividend_iff fact_0 fact_div_fact fact_gt_zero fact_nonzero gcd_nat.eq_iff le_antisym le_numeral_extra(3) le_numeral_extra(4) less_or_eq_imp_le mult_zero_right multiplicity_dvd_iff_dvd)
  also have "(\<Prod>i=1..n. i) = fact n"
    by (simp add: fact_prod)
  finally show "p ^ multiplicity p (fact n) dvd fact n" .
qed

lemma factors_in_factorial:

lemma lcm_gcd_product:
  fixes m n :: nat
  shows "lcm m n = m * n div gcd m n"
proof (cases "m = 0 \<or> n = 0")
  case True
  then show ?thesis
    by auto
next
  case False
  show ?thesis
  proof (rule dvd_antisym)
    have "m dvd lcm m n" by simp
    moreover have "n dvd lcm m n" by simp
    ultimately have "m * n dvd m * n * gcd m n div gcd m n"
      by (simp add: lcm_nat_def)
    then have "gcd m n * (m * n div gcd m n) dvd gcd m n * (m * n)"
      by auto
    then show "lcm m n dvd m * n div gcd m n"
      by (simp add: lcm_nat_def False)
    have "gcd m n dvd m" by simp
    moreover have "gcd m n dvd n" by simp
    ultimately have "gcd m n dvd m * n div lcm m n"
      by (metis dvd_mult_imp_div dvd_refl gcd_mult_lcm normalize_dvd_iff normalize_mult)
    then show "m * n div gcd m n dvd lcm m n"
      by (metis dvd_refl lcm_nat_def)
  qed
qed

theorem mathd_numbertheory_370:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes h0 : "n mod 7 = (3::nat)"
  shows "(2*n+1) mod 7 = (0::nat)"
proof -
  have "n = 7 * (n div 7) + (n mod 7)" by arith
  also have "... = 7 * (n div 7) + 3" using h0 by simp
  finally have c0: "n = 7 * (n div 7) + 3" by auto
  have "(2*n+1) = 2*(7*(n div 7) + 3) + 1" using c0 by simp
  then have c1: "(2*n+1) = 14*(n div 7) + 7" by simp
  have "(2*n+1) = 14*(n div 7) + 7" using c1 by simp
  then have "(2*n+1) = 7*(2*(n div 7)) + 7" by simp
  then have "(2*n+1) = 7*((2*(n div 7)) + 1)" by simp
  then have "(2*n+1) = 7*(2*(n div 7) + 1)" by simp
  then have c2: "(2*n+1) = 7*((2*n+1) div 7)" by simp
  have "(2*n+1) = 7*((2*n+1) div 7)" using c2 by simp
  then have c3: "(2*n+1) mod 7 = 0" by presburger
  then show ?thesis using c3 by blast
qed

theorem mathd_numbertheory_458:

theorem mathd_numbertheory_301:
  fixes j :: nat 
  assumes "j>0"
  shows "(3 * (7 * j + 3)) mod 7 = 2"
proof -
  have "(3 * (7 * j + 3)) = 21 * j + 9" by (simp add: distrib_left)
  then have "(3 * (7 * j + 3)) = 7 * (3 * j) + 7 * (9/7)" 
    by (simp add: distrib_left)
  then have "(3 * (7 * j + 3)) = 7 * (3 * j + 1) + 7 * (2/7)"
    by (simp add: multi_distrib_complex)
  then have "(3 * (7 * j + 3)) = 7 * (3 * j + 1) + 7 * 2 div 7"
    by auto
  then have "(3 * (7 * j + 3)) = 7 * (3 * j + 1) + 2" by simp
  then show ?thesis by presburger
qed

  fixes x :: real
  assumes h0: "x \<noteq> 0"
    and h1: "3 + 1/x = 7/x"
  shows "x = 2"
proof -
  have c0: "3 + 1/x = 7/x" using h1 by simp
  have c1: "3 = 7/x - 1/x" using c0 by simp
  have c2: "3 = 6/x" using c1 by simp

theorem amc12_2001_p2:
  fixes a b n::nat
  assumes "1 \<le> a \<and> a \<le> 9"
    and "0 \<le> b \<and> b \<le> 9"
    and "n = 10 * a + b"
    and "n = a * b + a + b"
  shows "b=9"
proof -
  have "n = 10 * a + b" using assms by simp
  moreover have "n = a * b + a + b" using assms by simp
  hence "10*a + b = a * b + a + b" using calculation by simp

  ultimately have "9 = b" using assms by simp
  then show ?thesis by auto
qed

theorem algebra_binomnegdiscrineq_10alt28asqp1:
  fixes a :: real
  shows "10 * a \<le> 28 * a^2 + 1"
proof -
  have "0 \<le> 28 * a^2 - 10 * a + 1"
  proof -
    have "0 \<le> (a - 5/28)^2"
      by simp
    then have "0 \<le> a^2 - 10/28 * a + (5/28)^2"
      by sos
    then have "0 \<le> 28 * (a^2 - 10/28 * a) + 25/28"
      by sos
    then have "0 \<le> 28 * a^2 - 10 * a + 25/28"
      by (simp add: distrib_left)
    moreover have "28 * a^2 - 10 * a + 25/28 < 28 * a^2 - 10 * a + 1"
      by simp
    ultimately show ?thesis
      by simp
  qed
  then show ?thesis
    by simp
qed

lemma cancle_div:
  fixes x a b c:: real
  assumes "x > 0" "a + b / x = c"

  then have "x * a + x * (b / x) = c * x" by (simp add: distrib_left)

qed

lemma mathd_numbertheory_33_lemma1:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes h0 : "n < 398"
    and h1 : "(n * 7) mod 398 = 1"
  shows "\<forall> n' < 398. (n' * 7) mod 398 = 1 \<longrightarrow> n = n'"
proof -
  { fix n' :: nat
    assume h2: "n' < 398"
    assume h3: "(n' * 7) mod 398 = 1"
    have "(n * 7) mod 398 = (n' * 7) mod 398" using h1 h3 by simp
    then have "n mod 398 = n' mod 398" by (smt (verit) ab_semigroup_mult_class.mult_ac(1) h1 mod_mult_right_eq mult.commute mult_numeral_1_right numerals(1))
    then have "n mod 398 = n' mod 398" using h0 h2 by presburger
    then have "n = n" by simp
    then have "n = n'" using h0 h2 by (smt (verit) \<open>n mod 398 = n' mod 398\<close> mod_less)
  }
  then show ?thesis by auto
qed

theorem mathd_numbertheory_370:
  fixes n :: nat

proof -

  also have "... = 7 * (n div 7) + 3" using h0 by simp
  finally have c0: "n = 7 * (n div 7) + 3" by auto
  have "(2*n+1) = 2*(7*(n div 7) + 3) + 1" using c0 by simp
  then have c1: "(2*n+1) = 14*(n div 7) + 7" by simp
  have "(2*n+1) = 14*(n div 7) + 7" using c1 by simp

  then have "(2*n+1) = 7*(2*(n div 7) + 1)" by simp
  then have c2: "(2*n+1) = 7*((2*n+1) div 7)" by simp
  have "(2*n+1) = 7*((2*n+1) div 7)" using c2 by simp

lemma mathd_numbertheory_33_lemma1:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes h0 : "n < 398"
    and h1 : "(n * 7) mod 398 = 1"
  shows "\<forall> n' < 398. (n' * 7) mod 398 = 1 \<longrightarrow> n = n'"
proof (rule ccontr)
  assume "\<not> (\<forall> n' < 398. (n' * 7) mod 398 = 1 \<longrightarrow> n = n')"
  then obtain n' where h2: "n' < 398" and h3: "(n' * 7) mod 398 = 1" and h4: "n \<noteq> n'" by auto
  have "(n * 7) mod 398 = (n' * 7) mod 398" using h1 h3 by simp
  then have "n mod 398 = n' mod 398" by (smt (verit) ab_semigroup_mult_class.mult_ac(1) h3 mod_mult_right_eq mult.commute mult_numeral_1_right numerals(1))
  hence "n mod 398 \<noteq> n' mod 398" using h4 by (metis h0 h2 mod_less semiring_norm(3))
  hence "n mod 398 - n' mod 398 \<noteq> 0" by (metis \<open>n mod 398 = n' mod 398\<close>)
  hence "n - n' \<noteq> 0" by (metis \<open>n mod 398 = n' mod 398\<close> \<open>n mod 398 \<noteq> n' mod 398\<close>)
  hence "\<bar>n - n'\<bar> > 0" by auto
  hence "\<bar>n - n'\<bar> \<ge> 1" by auto
  hence "\<bar>n - n'\<bar> * 7 \<ge> 1" by auto
  hence "(n - n') * 7 mod 398 \<ge> 1" by (metis \<open>n mod 398 = n' mod 398\<close> \<open>n mod 398 \<noteq> n' mod 398\<close>)
  hence "(n * 7 - n' * 7) mod 398 \<ge> 1" by (metis diff_mult_distrib2 mult.commute)
  hence "(n * 7) mod 398 - (n' * 7) mod 398 \<ge> 1" by (metis \<open>n mod 398 = n' mod 398\<close> \<open>n mod 398 \<noteq> n' mod 398\<close>)
  hence "1 \<le> (n * 7) mod 398 - (n' * 7) mod 398" by simp
  hence "1 \<le> (n * 7) mod 398 - 1" using h3 by simp
  hence "1 \<le> (n * 7) mod 398 - (n' * 7) mod 398 + 1" by simp
  hence "2 \<le> (n * 7) mod 398 - (n' * 7) mod 398 + 1" by (metis \<open>1 \<le> n * 7 mod 398 - n' * 7 mod 398\<close> \<open>n * 7 mod 398 = n' * 7 mod 398\<close> add.commute add_cancel_right_right add_leE comm_monoid_add_class.add_0 diff_self_eq_0 le_0_eq le_diff_conv le_iff_add less_diff_conv2 less_numeral_extra(1) nat_le_linear not_less_zero)
  hence "2 \<le> (n * 7) mod 398 - 1" using h3 by (metis \<open>n mod 398 = n' mod 398\<close> \<open>n mod 398 \<noteq> n' mod 398\<close>)
  hence "2 \<le> (n * 7) mod 398" by simp
  hence "2 \<le> 1" using h1 by simp
  thus False by (metis Suc_1 Suc_n_not_le_n inc.simps(1))
qed

lemma cancle_div:
  fixes x a b c:: real
  assumes "x > 0" "a + b / x = c"
  shows "a * x + b = c * x"
proof -
  have "x * (a + b / x) = c * x"
    using assms(2) by auto
  then have "x * a + x * (b / x) = c * x"
    by (simp add: distrib_left)
  then show ?thesis
    using assms(1) by (simp add: mult.commute)
qed

lemma distribute_division:
  fixes a b c x :: real
  assumes "x \<noteq> 0" "a + b / x = c"
  shows "a * x + b = c * x"
proof -
  have "x * (a + b / x) = c * x" using assms(2) by auto
  then have "x * a + x * (b / x) = c * x" by (simp add: distrib_left)
  then have "x * a + b = c * x" using assms(1) by (simp add: mult.commute)
  then show ?thesis by sos
qed

theorem mathd_numbertheory_458:

  assumes h0 : "n mod 8 = (7::nat)"
  shows "n mod 4 = 3"
proof -
  have "n = 8*(n div 8) + (n mod 8)" by arith
  also have "... = 8*(n div 8) + 7" using h0 by simp
  finally have c0: "n = 8*(n div 8) + 7" by auto
  have "n = 4*(2*(n div 8) + 1) + 3" using c0 by auto
  then have c1: "n mod 4 = 3" by presburger
  then show ?thesis using c1 by blast
qed

lemma mathd_numbertheory_412_lemma1:
  fixes x y z :: nat
  assumes h0 : "x mod z = y"
    and h1 : "x mod z = y mod z"

proof -
  have "y mod z = (x mod z) mod z" by (simp add: assms(1))
  also have "... = y mod z" by (simp add: assms(2))
  finally show ?thesis by (metis h0 h1)
qed

lemma mathd_numbertheory_412_lemma1:

lemma mathd_numbertheory_412_lemma1:
  fixes x y :: nat
  assumes h0 : "x mod n = (a:: nat)"
    and h1 : "y mod n = (b:: nat)"
  shows "(x + 1) mod n = (a + 1) mod n"
proof -
  have "(x + 1) mod n = ((a + 1) + (x div n) * n) mod n"
    by (metis Suc_eq_plus1 h0 mod_Suc_eq mod_mult_self1)
  also have "... = (a + 1) mod n"
    by simp
  finally show ?thesis
    by simp
qed

lemma mathd_numbertheory_412_lemma1:

theorem mathd_numbertheory_370:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes h0 : "n mod 7 = (3::nat)"
  shows "(2*n+1) mod 7 = (0::nat)"
proof -
  have "n = 7 * (n div 7) + (n mod 7)" by arith
  also have "... = 7 * (n div 7) + 3" using h0 by simp
  finally have c0: "n = 7 * (n div 7) + 3" by auto
  have "(2*n+1) = 2*(7*(n div 7) + 3) + 1" using c0 by simp
  then have c1: "(2*n+1) = 14*(n div 7) + 7" by simp
  have "(2*n+1) = 14*(n div 7) + 7" using c1 by simp
  then have "(2*n+1) = 7*(2*(n div 7)) + 7" by simp
  then have "(2*n+1) = 7*((2*(n div 7)) + 1)" by simp
  then have "(2*n+1) = 7*(2*(n div 7) + 1)" by simp
  then have c2: "(2*n+1) = 7*((2*n+1) div 7)" by simp
  have "(2*n+1) = 7*((2*n+1) div 7)" using c2 by simp
  then have c3: "(2*n+1) mod 7 = 0" by presburger
  then show ?thesis using c3 by blast
qed

theorem mathd_numbertheory_301:
  fixes j :: nat 
  assumes "j>0"
  shows "(3 * (7 * j + 3)) mod 7 = 2"
proof -
  have "(3 * (7 * j + 3)) = 21 * j + 9" by (simp add: distrib_left)
  then have "(3 * (7 * j + 3)) = 7 * (3 * j) + 7 * (9/7)" 
    by (simp add: distrib_left)
  then have "(3 * (7 * j + 3)) = 7 * (3 * j + 1) + 7 * (2/7)"
    by (simp add: multi_distrib_complex)
  then have "(3 * (7 * j + 3)) = 7 * (3 * j + 1) + 7 * 2 div 7"
    by auto
  then have "(3 * (7 * j + 3)) = 7 * (3 * j + 1) + 2" by simp
  then show ?thesis by presburger
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_110:
  fixes q e :: complex
  assumes h0 : "q = Complex 2 (-2)"
    and h1 : "e = Complex 5 5"
  shows "q * e = 20"
proof -
  have "q * e = (Complex 2 (-2)) * (Complex 5 5)"
    using assms by simp
  also have "... = Complex (2 * 5 - (-2) * 5) ((-2) * 5 + 2 * 5)"
    by eval
  also have "... = Complex (10 + 10) ((-10) + 10)"
    by simp
  also have "... = Complex 20 0"
    by simp
  finally show ?thesis
    by (smt (verit) Complex_eq_numeral \<open>Complex 2 (- 2) * Complex 5 5 = Complex (2 * 5 - - 2 * 5) (- 2 * 5 + 2 * 5)\<close> \<open>q * e = Complex 2 (- 2) * Complex 5 5\<close> diff_numeral_special(3) diff_numeral_special(8) numeral_Bit0 numeral_Bit1 semiring_norm(2) sub_num_simps(1))
qed

lemma lcm_property:
  fixes a b c :: nat
  assumes "a dvd c" and "b dvd c" and "coprime a b"
  shows "lcm a b dvd c"
  using assms by (simp add: lcm_least)

lemma gcd_property:
  fixes a b c :: nat
  assumes "c dvd a" and "c dvd b" and "coprime a b"
  shows "c dvd gcd a b"
proof -
  have "a = gcd a b * (a div gcd a b)" using gcd_dvd1[of a b] by simp
  then have "c dvd gcd a b * (a div gcd a b)" using assms(1) by simp
  then have "c dvd gcd a b" using assms(2) dvd_mult_cancel_right[of c "gcd a b" "(a div gcd a b)"] by simp
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma period_mod:
  fixes a b m :: nat
  assumes "a mod m = b mod m"
  shows "(a^n) mod m = (b^n) mod m"
proof (induct n)
  case 0
  then show ?case by simp
next
  case (Suc n)
  have "(a ^ Suc n) mod m = (a * (a^n)) mod m" by simp
  also have "... = (a mod m * (a^n) mod m) mod m" by (metis mod_mod_trivial mod_mult_left_eq)
  also have "... = (b mod m * (a^n) mod m) mod m" using assms by simp
  also have "... = (b * (a^n)) mod m" by (metis \<open>a ^ Suc n mod m = a * a ^ n mod m\<close> assms calculation mod_mult_cong)
  also have "... = (b ^ Suc n) mod m" by (smt (verit) One_nat_def Suc mod_mult_cong plus_1_eq_Suc power_Suc0_right power_add)
  finally show ?case by simp
qed

    by (smt (verit) mod_add_left_eq power_mod)
  also have "... = (a + b)^c mod n"
    using assms(4) by auto
  finally show ?thesis by auto
qed

lemma prime_divides_squared_implies_divides:
  fixes n :: int
    and p :: nat
  assumes "prime p" "p dvd (n^2)"
  shows "p dvd n"
proof -
  have "p dvd (n^2) \<longrightarrow> p dvd n"
    using assms prime_dvd_mult_nat by (smt (verit) prime_dvd_power_int prime_nat_int_transfer)
  thus ?thesis using assms by auto
qed

theorem numbertheory_sqmod4in01d:
  fixes a :: int
  shows "(a^2 mod 4 = 0) \<or> (a^2 mod 4 = 1)"
proof -
  have c0: "a mod 4 = 0 \<or> a mod 4 = 1 \<or> a mod 4 = 2 \<or> a mod 4 = 3"
    by presburger
  have c1: "(a mod 4)^2 mod 4 = (a^2) mod 4"
    by (metis of_nat_power power_mod)
  then have "(a mod 4)^2 mod 4 = 0 \<or> (a mod 4)^2 mod 4 = 1"
    using c0 by auto
  then show ?thesis
    using c1 by auto
qed

lemma prime_factor_divides:
  fixes n p :: nat
  assumes "prime p" "p dvd n"
  shows "p dvd (m*n)"
  using assms prime_dvd_mult_nat by blast

lemma prime_factorization_properties:
  fixes n p :: nat
  assumes "prime p" "\<forall> k. p^k dvd n \<longrightarrow> k = 0"
  shows "p dvd m \<longleftrightarrow> p dvd (m*n)"
proof
  assume "p dvd m"
  then obtain k where "m = p * k" using assms(1) by (auto simp: prime_nat_iff)
  hence "m * n = p * k * n" by simp
  thus "p dvd (m*n)" by auto
next
  assume "p dvd (m*n)"
  hence "p dvd m * n" by auto
  hence "p dvd m \<or> p dvd n" using assms(1) by (metis prime_dvd_mult_iff)
  thus "p dvd m" using assms(2) by (metis power_one_right zero_neq_one)
qed

  fixes n :: nat 
  shows "(\<Sum> k<n. 2 * k + 3) = (n + 1)^2 - 1"
proof (induction n)
  case 0
  then show ?case by simp
next
  case (Suc n)
  then have "(\<Sum> k<Suc n. 2 * k + 3) = (\<Sum> k<n. 2 * k + 3) + (2 * n + 3)" by simp
  also have "... = (n + 1)^2 - 1 + (2 * n + 3)" using Suc.IH by simp
  also have "... = n^2 + 2 * n + 1 - 1 + 2 * n + 3" by (simp add: power2_eq_square)

  fixes x e :: complex
  assumes h0 : "x + e = 7"
    and h1 : "2 * x + e = 3"
  shows "e=11 \<and> x= (-4)"
proof -
  (* Step 1: Subtract the equation $x + e = 7$ from the equation $2x + e = 3$ to eliminate the variable $e$. *)
  have "2 * x + e - (x + e) = 3 - 7"
    using assms by simp
  then have "x = -4"
    by simp

  (* Step 2: Substitute the value of $x$ obtained in Step 1, which is $-4$, into the equation $x + e = 7$. *)
  have "-4 + e = 7"
    using assms by simp

  (* Step 3: Solve the equation $-4 + e = 7$ to find the value of $e$. *)
  then have "e = 11"
    by simp

  (* Step 4: Conclude that $e = 11$ and $x = -4$. *)
  then show "e=11 \<and> x= (-4)"
    using \<open>x = -4\<close> by simp
qed

theory algebra_amgm_faxinrrp2msqrt2geq2mxm1div2x
  imports Complex_Main
begin

(* lemma 1: *)
lemma am_gm:
  fixes x::real
  assumes "x > 0"
  shows "x + 1/(2*x) \<ge> sqrt 2"
proof -
  have "x > 0 \<and> 1/(2*x) > 0" using assms by simp
  then have "(x + 1/(2*x)) / 2 \<ge> sqrt (x * (1/(2*x)))" by (metis arith_geo_mean_sqrt assms div_by_1 divide_eq_0_iff divide_le_0_iff divide_le_eq_1_pos le_divide_eq_1 le_numeral_extra(3) less_numeral_extra(3) mult.commute mult_2_right zero_le_divide_1_iff zero_le_double_add_iff_zero_le_single_add)
  then have "(x + 1/(2*x)) / 2 \<ge> sqrt ((x * 1) / (2*x))" by simp
  then have "(x + 1/(2*x)) / 2 \<ge> sqrt (1 / 2)" by (metis \<open>0 < x \<and> 0 < 1 / (2 * x)\<close> add.right_neutral add_divide_eq_if_simps(2) add_divide_eq_iff comm_monoid_mult_class.mult_1 dbl_def dbl_simps(3) div_by_1 div_self divide_divide_eq_right double_zero_sym less_add_same_cancel2 mult.commute mult_2 nonzero_mult_div_cancel_left one_add_one power_inject_exp power_one times_divide_times_eq zero_neq_numeral zero_neq_one)
  then have "(x + 1/(2*x)) / 2 \<ge> (sqrt 1) / (sqrt 2)" by (metis frac_eq_eq mult.commute mult_2_right real_sqrt_divide zero_neq_numeral)
  then have "(x + 1/(2*x)) / 2 \<ge> 1 / (sqrt 2)" by simp
  then have "(x + 1/(2*x)) / 2 \<ge> sqrt 2 / (sqrt 2 * sqrt 2)" by (smt (verit) \<open>sqrt 1 / sqrt 2 \<le> (x + 1 / (2 * x)) / 2\<close> nonzero_divide_mult_cancel_left real_sqrt_eq_zero_cancel real_sqrt_one)
  then have "(x + 1/(2*x)) / 2 \<ge> sqrt 2 / 2" by simp
  then have "x + 1/(2*x) \<ge> 2 * (sqrt 2 / 2)" by simp
  then have "x + 1/(2*x) \<ge> sqrt 2" by simp
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

(* formal statement copy from the input*)
theorem algebra_amgm_faxinrrp2msqrt2geq2mxm1div2x:
  "\<And>x. (x>0) \<Longrightarrow> 2 - sqrt 2 \<ge> 2 - x - 1/ (2 * x)"
proof -
  fix x::real
  assume h0: "x>0"
  (*Step 1: We want to show that $x + \frac{1}{2x} \geq \sqrt{2}$ is true.*)
  (* Step 2: Apply the AM-GM inequality to $x$ and $\frac{1}{2x}$ to get $x + \frac{1}{2x} \geq 2\sqrt{\frac{x}{2x}}$. *)
  (* Step 3: Simplify $2\sqrt{\frac{x}{2x}}$ to $\sqrt{2}$. *)
  (* Step 4: Conclude that $x + \frac{1}{2x} \geq \sqrt{2}$ is true. *)
  have "x + 1/(2*x) \<ge> sqrt 2" using am_gm[OF h0] by simp
  (* Step 5: Since $2 - \sqrt{2} \geq 2 - x - \frac{1}{2x}$ is equivalent to $x + \frac{1}{2x} \geq \sqrt{2}$, we can conclude that $2 - \sqrt{2} \geq 2 - x - \frac{1}{2x}$ is true. *)
  then show "2 - sqrt 2 \<ge> 2 - x - 1/ (2 * x)" by simp
qed

end
```

theory algebra_amgm_sumasqdivbsqgeqsumbdiva
  imports Complex_Main "HOL-Library.Sum_of_Squares"
begin

(* formal statement copy from the input *)
theorem algebra_amgm_sumasqdivbsqgeqsumbdiva:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes h0 : "0 < a \<and> 0 < b \<and> 0 < c"
  shows "a^2 / b^2 + b^2 / c^2 + c^2 / a^2 \<ge> b / a + c / b + a / c"
proof -
  (* Step 1: Define $\alpha = a/b$, $\beta = b/c$, and $\gamma = c/a$. *)
  define \<alpha> where "\<alpha> = a/b"
  define \<beta> where "\<beta> = b/c"
  define \<gamma> where "\<gamma> = c/a"

  (* Step 2: Apply AM-GM inequality to $\alpha$ and $\beta$ to obtain $\frac{1}{2}(\alpha^2 + \beta^2) \geq \alpha\beta$. *)
  have "\<alpha> * \<beta> \<le> (1/2) * (\<alpha>^2 + \<beta>^2)"
    by (simp add: \<alpha>_def \<beta>_def assms(1) am_gm)

  (* Step 3: Add the inequalities cyclically over the three variables to obtain $\alpha^2 + \beta^2 + \gamma^2 \geq \alpha\beta + \beta\gamma + \alpha\gamma$. *)
  moreover have "\<beta> * \<gamma> \<le> (1/2) * (\<beta>^2 + \<gamma>^2)"
    by (simp add: \<beta>_def \<gamma>_def assms(1) am_gm)
  moreover have "\<gamma> * \<alpha> \<le> (1/2) * (\<gamma>^2 + \<alpha>^2)"
    by (simp add: \<alpha>_def \<gamma>_def assms(1) am_gm)
  ultimately have "\<alpha>^2 + \<beta>^2 + \<gamma>^2 \<ge> \<alpha> * \<beta> + \<beta> * \<gamma> + \<gamma> * \<alpha>"
    by simp

  (* Step 4: Replace $\alpha$, $\beta$, and $\gamma$ with $a/b$, $b/c$, and $c/a$, respectively, to obtain the desired inequality. *)
  then have "a^2/b^2 + b^2/c^2 + c^2/a^2 \<ge> (a/b) * (b/c) + (b/c) * (c/a) + (c/a) * (a/b)"
    by (simp add: \<alpha>_def \<beta>_def \<gamma>_def)

  (* Step 5: Conclude that the inequality holds for any three positive real numbers $a$, $b$, and $c$. *)
  then show ?thesis using assms(1)
    by (simp add: field_simps)
qed

end
```

  imports Complex_Main
begin

(* no helper lemma are required *)

(* formal statement copy from the input*)
theorem algebra_binomnegdiscrineq_10alt28asqp1:
  fixes a :: real
  shows "10 * a \<le> 28 * a^2 + 1"
proof -
  (* Step 1: We want to show that 10a \<le> 28a^2 + 1, which is equivalent to 0 \<le> 28a^2 - 10a + 1. *)
  have "0 \<le> 28 * a^2 - 10 * a + 1"
  proof -
    (* Step 2: Consider completing the square for 28a^2 - 10a and observe that (a - 5/28)^2 = a^2 - 10/28a + (5/28)^2. *)
    have "0 \<le> (a - 5/28)^2"
      by simp
    (* Step 3: Since 0 \<le> (a - 5/28)^2, we have 0 \<le> a^2 - 10/28a + (5/28)^2. *)
    then have "0 \<le> a^2 - 10/28 * a + (5/28)^2"
      by simp
    (* Step 4: Multiply both sides of the inequality by 28 and simplify terms to get 0 \<le> 28a^2 - 10a + 25/28. *)
    then have "0 \<le> 28 * (a^2 - 10/28 * a) + 25/28"
      by simp
    then have "0 \<le> 28 * a^2 - 10 * a + 25/28"
      by (simp add: distrib_left)
    (* Step 5: Since 25/28 < 1, we can conclude that 0 \<le> 28a^2 - 10a + 25/28 < 28a^2 - 10a + 1. *)
    moreover have "28 * a^2 - 10 * a + 25/28 < 28 * a^2 - 10 * a + 1"
      by simp
    ultimately show ?thesis
      by simp
  qed
  (* Step 6: Therefore, 0 \<le> 28a^2 - 10a + 1, which implies 10a \<le> 28a^2 + 1. *)
  then show ?thesis
    by simp
qed

end

  shows "36 * (a * z) - 9 * a^2 \<le> 36 * z^2"
proof -
  (* Step 1: Rewrite the inequality as $2 \cdot (3a) \cdot (6z) - (3a)^2 \leq (6z)^2$. *)
  have c1: "36 * (a * z) - 9 * a^2 = 2 * (3 * a) * (6 * z) - (3 * a)^2"
    by (simp add: power2_eq_square)
  
  (* Step 2: Simplify the left side of the inequality to get $2 \cdot (3a) \cdot (6z) \leq (3a)^2 + (6z)^2$. *)
  have c2: "2 * (3 * a) * (6 * z) \<le> (3 * a)^2 + (6 * z)^2"
    using algebra_sqineq_2xyxysq[of "3 * a" "6 * z"] by simp
  
  (* Step 3: Use the inequality $x^2 + y^2 \geq 2xy$ for all real numbers $x$ and $y$, with $x = 3a$ and $y = 6z$. *)
  have c3: "(3 * a)^2 + (6 * z)^2 \<ge> 2 * (3 * a) * (6 * z)"
    using algebra_sqineq_2xyxysq[of "3 * a" "6 * z"]
    by simp
  
  (* Step 4: Conclude that $36az - 9a^2 \leq 36z^2$. *)
  have "2 * (3 * a) * (6 * z) \<le> (3 * a)^2 + (6 * z)^2"
    using c2 c3 by simp
  then have "36 * (a * z) - 9 * a^2 \<le> 36 * z^2"
    using c1 by simp
  then show ?thesis 
    by simp
qed

theory amc12_2000_p11
  imports Complex_Main
begin

(* Lemma 1: \(\frac{a^2 + b^2}{a-b} - \frac{(a-b)^2}{(a-b)} = \frac{2ab}{a-b}\) *)
lemma substitution_and_arithmetic:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "a \<noteq> b"
  shows "(a^2 + b^2) / (a - b) - (a - b) = 2 * a * b / (a - b)"
proof -
  have "(a^2 + b^2) / (a - b) - (a - b) = (a^2 + b^2 - (a - b)^2) / (a - b)"
    by (simp add: diff_divide_distrib)
  also have "... = (a^2 + b^2 - (a^2 - 2 * a * b + b^2)) / (a - b)"
    by (simp add: power2_eq_square)
  also have "... = (2 * a * b) / (a - b)"
    using assms by simp
  finally show ?thesis by auto
qed

(* formal statement copy from the input *)
theorem amc12_2000_p11:
  fixes a b::real
  assumes "a \<noteq> 0" "b \<noteq> 0"
      and "a * b = a - b"
    shows "a / b + b / a - a * b = 2"
proof -
  (* Step 1: Rewrite the expression \(\frac{a}{b} + \frac{b}{a} - ab\) as \(\frac{a^2 + b^2}{ab} - (a - b)\) *)
  have "a / b + b / a - a * b = (a^2 + b^2) / (a * b) - (a - b)"
    using assms by simp
  
  (* Step 2: Simplify the expression \(\frac{a^2 + b^2}{ab} - (a - b)\) to \(\frac{a^2 + b^2}{a-b} - \frac{(a-b)^2}{(a-b)}\) *)
  also have "... = (a^2 + b^2) / (a - b) - (a - b)"
    using assms by auto
  
  (* Step 3: Simplify the expression \(\frac{a^2 + b^2}{a-b} - \frac{(a-b)^2}{(a-b)}\) to \(\frac{2ab}{a-b}\) *)
  also have "... = 2 * a * b / (a - b)"
    using substitution_and_arithmetic[where a="a" and b="b"] assms(3) by simp
  
  (* Step 4: Simplify the expression \(\frac{2ab}{a-b}\) to \(2\) *)
  also have "... = 2" using assms by simp
  
  (* Step 5: Conclude that \(\frac{a}{b} + \frac{b}{a} - ab = 2\) *)
  finally show ?thesis by auto
qed

end

  have c0: "\<bar>x -2\<bar> = 2 - x" using assms(1) by linarith
